THANKS FOR YOUR INTEREST SUPER FAN! 

The #CheerForPeace fundraising campaign has now moved to our Co-creation Blog Space on CheerForPeace.Wordpress.com

There, you can contribute financially &/or with your creative input in the campaign as we grow into a worldwide movement that touches even more people's lives!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


The unprecedented "Fan Fest for the Rest" occurred in Curitiba's Vila Torres Community, a forgotten & marginalized region of the modern Brazilian city, on the eve of the World Cup, June 15th, 2014
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Thanks to your contribution, Give&Game Fan Fest #1 is confirmed!

Where? Curitiba, Parana (World Cup Host City), Vila Torres Community
Check out the Facebook Event Here


More Give&Games to be confirmed soon!
Ideas? You're more than welcome to join in the co-creation now!


Celebrating a Peacefully Better WorldCup

It's true that mega-events impact the earth & our communities in a BIG way! 

DID YOU KNOW? World Cup 2010 in South Africa had the biggest carbon footprint so far of any event in history!

EVEN WORSE: Air Travel Across Brazil will Double 2014 World Cup carbon emissions compared to 2010!

CONSIDER THIS: With millions of people traveling to and around Brazil for the World Cup, what's the impacts on marginalized communities?

But it's also true that together, we can create positive change!

With a small contribution, one fan at a time, 

We CAN make a BIG difference!

Canadian students collect soccer kits for donation in needy communities.

PEACE, Redefined!

  SOCIAL - ENVIRONMENTAL - ECONOMIC


Let's make sure, that the planet & the "Rest of Brazil" benefit too!

Checkout the awesome perk packages including incentives to get caring individuals like yourself involved in making mega-events like this World Cup greener & more socially equitable while being rewarded in a
way that feels just awesome! 

Feel GREAT Giving & Gaining Today:

It's the New Way to Reward Yourself!

Each of the perk packages offered creates positive impact in a meaningful way while focusing on the basic pillars of the solutions proposed by the campaign:

  • Trees planted by SOS Mata Atlantica, an NGO that plants them in the devastated Atlantic Rainforest,  they are monitored for 5 years and certified for optimal survival rates.
  • Meals donated to Brazilian communities in need
  • Jerseys & football kits provided for underprivileged Brazilian youth
  • Awesome safe & fun social inclusion events like Give & Game soccer games: Vila Torres (link to video here, link to event here), Curitiba, June (more locations & dates to be confirmed!)
  • ALL PERKS include a special invitation to any 1 or more of our Give & Game soccer events where you can physically join in the fun too!

Checkout the Awesome Perks

More perks & packages are made available everyday. Your ideas welcome too!

Select 1 now or ask us to create a Special Package Just for You!

Also remember that ALL PERK packages include a special invite for you to any 1 or more of the Give & Game soccer events going on across Brazil!
Got a question, suggestion or idea about the perks or the campaign?
Don't see the perk or package that would be ideal for you?
Please don't hesitate to ask us now via this page or email us.
We are available all day to help you co-create perk packages with us!


LIMITED Ed. #CheerForPeace Brasil 14 Jersey

The Stylish Fan Jersey that Just Means A Whole Lot More is Made in Brazil
from Recycled Materials. Your Choice to Donate it or Rock it Yourself!

Prefer to wear the colors of your country while still showing your love? 

Boy do we have a challenge for you:

  • Get 20 fans supporting your team to pick-up a perk package that includes a jersey for you & you've got it: CUSTOMIZED jerseys in your team's colors!
  • Make sure you share your contribution with others fans so they join you.
  • Wondering how it works in your unique situation? Talk to us now!


The E-Book Campaign

 JABUJICABA (website)
A Novel Campaign
Inspiring action for Brazil’s rainforest & its wildlife, Jabujicaba is about immersing yourself in the novel, falling in love with the rainforest, and engaging in action to help save it. A portion of the proceeds from the e-book go to the World Land Trust towards forest conservation.


WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Your contribution goes directly to support the perks provided in each package and all additional proceeds go towards the following:

  • IndieGoGo platform fees: 10% if we we don't reach our goal & 5% if we do (this is why it's important to help reach the campaign target!)
  • Payment processing fees: 3-5% go to CreditCard & Paypal processing

The rest are directed towards an account that distributes the funds, based on your selected perks, to one or more of the following entities:

  • Planting trees via the NGO SOS Mata Atlantica
  • Providing meals in needy communities (ODPH plus a couple of other NGOs are at the table, we're waiting to confirm the ones we could help most & will make sure to update you)
  • Shirt makers & printers (various local Brazilian companies)
  • Purchasing the Jabujicaba e-books (website) where the royalties go to the World Land Trust (website)

IMPORTANT DISCLOSURE:

  • We are a lean team & are not withdrawing any profits or wages
  • Any additional funds will be re-directed towards strengthening the movement & its ability to deliver even more meaningful ongoing campaigns leading towards other mega-events like the Olympics games in 2016 & future World Cups too! 
  • Football For Kids foundation does NOT receive cash. The initiative is only involved in the collection & distribution of kit donations. Sponsors are welcome to discuss opportunities for partnership.


WHO STARTED THIS MOVEMENT?


Meet your Starting11 #CheerForPeace international campaign team (look us up below or on Facebook). We are the individuals who are mobilizing the student-led movement (led by Trilhas Empresa Junior at the Federal University of Parana in Brazil, more below) & asking for your support in our mission to celebrate a better World Cup for everyone. Want to join the many others as part of the extended team? Tryouts are ongoing so get in touch!

     

1) Football For Kids Foundation
Initiative started by people like you & I who believe in a more fair society.

Facebook Fan Page Here

  • The mission is to spread the massive wealth generated via soccer so that even the least privileged can enjoy the benefits of the world's favorite game too!
  • Since 2009, the initiative has collected and distributed thousands of donated football kits in developing communities across Brazil

2) Trilhas (EJ Turismo UFPR)
Student-led Jr. Enterprise of Tourism at the Federal University of Parana
Trilhas Website Here

  • Leading group on behalf of the student enterprise movement across Brazil
  • The primary goal is to provide much needed real-world experience for these students (checkout the Heroic Perk packages with students for hire)
  • A part of the funds will be re-directed towards the development of a more effective Jr Enterprise movement so even more students have the privilege

3) YOU!
As a co-created movement, individuals like yourself are key to the success!

  • Contribute your critique by telling us what & how to improve,
  • Get involved in the continuous recreation of the ongoing campaign
  • Share with your friends & organizations who should get involved too!
Want to get involved in a deeper way? 
We're always looking for awesome campaigners to join the team!

MAKING YOUR IMPACT VISIBLE

Brand New Customized Game Jerseys for Rocinha's Football Team donated by traveling students from Fanshawe College, Canada, in Rio de Janeiro during February, 2014


Your Contribution Doesn't Stop Here!

Although your support goes a long way, we still depend on caring individuals like you to get more supporters coming on board.

  • Get in touch with your friends, family & networks to get the word out.
  • Use the share tools provided by Indiegogo to share this campaign on your favorite social networks!
  • The co-creation space is here: http://cheerforpeace.wordpress.com/
  • LIKE on Facebook: http://facebook.com/footballforkidsfoundation
  • FOLLOW on Twitter: @CheerForPeace

Questions or Concerns?

Got a question, suggestion or idea about the perks or the campaign? What about the distribution of your contribution? You have every right to know!
Just ask us! We are available all day to help you make the right decision.

Thanks for Being Supremely Awesome!

Thanks so much for backing the campaign that looks to make this
World Cup the greenest and fairest in the history of the game.
Consider yourself a co-creator of a much bigger initiative that we build
together going forward! Join now & put your name on #CheerForPeace



The #CheerForPeace Starting11: the first 11 contributors via IndieGoGo. Create your own Starting11 too by rounding up your friends & family to give. We'll create a special poster for you & make sure the fans of the world know of the good cause you're supporting! Get in touch with us today.
story_txt:

story:
Gowanus Athletic?

Named for the Gowanus Canal - the industrial Brooklyn backwater. Gowanus Athletic is a circle of friends and soccer club competing for glory in the shadow of the Brooklyn Bridge. In our emblem we pay homage to Sludgie, the young Minke Whale who in 2007 lost his life in a fateful excursion up the canal into Kings County.

Gowanus Athletic is proud to release our inaugural club supporter T with original artwork by Brooklyn based artist, goalkeeper and animal lover, Andy Thompson. 

Funds raised will support the creation of Gowanus Athletic uniforms and 10% of proceeds will go directly to The Blue Ocean Institute which seeks to create a more knowledgeable constituency for conservation. 

So to recap..

1. You get a swanky T made in Brooklyn.
2. Gowanus creates swanky uniforms.
3. Marine life breathes a little easier.



"My thoughts are with the whale." - Mayor Mike Bloomberg Apr 19, 2007

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. How do I choose my sex and size? 
Easy, by selecting the perk that matches your sex and size. Gowanus Athletic Ts are available in men's and women's small, medium, large and extra large.

Q. How do I get my shirt?
Select a perk, enter your address and we'll send your shirt right along for free!

Q. Do you ship internationally? If so, what is the cost?
Yes! Please add $20 to your perk for all international orders.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
We are

Rebecca Roe & Heather Thomas. We are independent creatives, raising young artist families.  We are expanding our original shop into a Bazaar, a space where retail, design, and events feature local and original works.

Fashion Show @The Painted Bride 2010

 

Heather

~Stylist, thrift & vintage curator, fashion & accessory designer, children’s apparel, playwright~

Heather heads our Thrift & Vintage dept., with a sharp eye for style, and directs many of our awesome fashion promo videos & photo shoots with her partner Courtnee Owens.  She recently launched her own line, Uaminifu in 2016, a fresh collection for children & adults. She has lived in Philadelphia since 2007.

See Heather & Courtnee in action, a look behind the scenes of a typical fashion photoshoot

Behind the Scenes (1 min)

 

Rebecca

~Artist, self-taught jewelry designer, educator, co-founder of ROCKERS music movement~

Rebecca heads our creative workshop dept., with a passion for design and education. “In our first store, we graduated over a dozen University design students from our fashion internship, preparing them for the industry they were moving into. They learned basic retail concepts, supply & manufacturing practices in a global market, how to create a brand and market it- I didn't learn some of these things in my degree program and felt like the store offered an authentic learning & design space.”

Rebecca launched Elk Neck, a jewelry line, in 2013. "I love earrings so much that I started making them. Then people wanted to know where I got my earrings and if I sold them. Next thing I know, I'm teaching myself about metals, learning how to solder." Rebecca moved to Philadelphia in 1999 and co-founded ROCKERS! along with Camae Ayewa, a monthly live music series that spanned 10 years. 

Vision for retail workshop

Rebecca and D.A. Hamid of OGNK joined forces early on to launch the events that became a major aspect of the company. Events included branding & marketing independent designers, art workshops/open house free to the public, fashion shows, and styled photo shoots.

Philadelphia Fashion Week Promo (0:30)

 

D.A. Hamid

Apparel, Headwear and Accessories designer, marketing/branding director. He launched OGNK in 2001, which is carried in stores in NYC, London and LA.

D.A. Hamid (OGNK) is a visual/performance artist and urban entrepreneur with more than 15 years of combined creative art and industry experience. From commercial & industry publishing to street and urban art, he has been immersed in the Design/Arts Industry: (fashion, digital design & development, art direction, company branding & identity, social media publishing & marketing) since 2001. 

  • NYC fashion week
  • Fashion district and vintage couture
  • London Theatre & UK Theatre dance projects
  • Philadelphia Fringe Arts Festival 
  • Philly Fashion Week

OGNK~  all original art and apparel is the schtick. Our motto is “Go ahead, Be different!” Something that will hold true to our (and our fans’) true vision which is to not be afraid to break the mold of conformity and hyper normalization. 

OGNK features classic sportswear, original streetwear, headwear and accessories. All weather. All style. All day.

OGNK ~ The original spelling for the word "Organic"

Over 14k community volunteer hours with national and local organizations, and more than 6k classroom teaching hours working with underprivileged minorities, OGNK strives to support art in our communities through youth engagement

Our Story

We opened our doors in Philadelphia in 2011 on Fabric Row, and spent 3 years creating a burgeoning hub for artists, designers, and creatives in our city. We combined a powerful mix of retail, original designs created in our onsite workshop, and creative events.

Original store Sept. 2011

"Essentially you could come in, buy affordable clothing, have it altered in-store as a customer. Our selection featured curated vintage, thrift and original apparel. In our workshop, our free internship offered: design skills, access to equipment & resources, and an avenue to sell your designs directly to the public. The space often featured clothing & accessory designs of several rotating independent artists. In order to introduce a new designer to the public, we hosted launch events or open houses. During these events, guests could participate in live art activities, such as block printing. People came to shop as much as they came to learn about other artists, or participate in events or workshops. As we grew, people wanted more of it."

 

Arty Party June 2012

"To celebrate the launch of independent designers in our store, we hosted an Arty Party. In the June launch, guests learned to make African Print Bowtie Earrings, and created Tutu's from remnants of fabric."

 

Tattooed Moms, Philadelphia 2015. Photo by Courtnee Owens

Vision

We believe that creative & artistic endeavors should be accessible. Our goal to is to expand our current vision and open a larger space, Rockers Closet Bazaar, to continue our work. “We combine the sustainable practices of carrying handmade/original works, vintage, and thrift with creative initiatives. In a time where many artists’ work is co-opted with ease by commercial brands, we strive to designate a space that is dedicated to promoting original works in which marginalized artists have both visibility & creative control- RC Bazaar is an arts cornerstone of its community. “

What happens in the space

Retail

Independent original designs, curated thrift & vintage

Resident Designers OGNK, Elk Neck & " " continue to create the independent collections out of RC Bazaar. These collections are original design mainstays of our space.

OGNK

OGNK features classic sportswear, original streetwear, headwear and accessories.

 

Elk Neck

Elk Neck features handmade jewelry in bold yet simple shapes.

Uaminifu

Uaminifu features beautiful apparel prints, across adult, children's, and accessory collections.

RC Mini Collection for children

Gallery Classes

This aspect of our space creates a platform for teaching artists to bring industry skills to the public, preferably to young, QTPOC, and marginalized artists that have limited access to apprenticeships. Digital Market Design & Entrepreneurship, Apparel Design, Jewelry Making, Block Printing, Knitting, Screen Printing, Batik, etc.

Design Internships: 3 month program/apprenticeship that builds design & production skills with an entrepreneurial small-business approach. RC Bazaar is a partner with AIPH, Drexel, UPenn, & Temple Universities.

Jewelry & Metalworking Arts: Rotating guest designers lead workshops for the public that teach various skills & and techniques for creating jewelry, small sculptures, art.

Upcycling

Altering thrift and vintage apparel, a fresh spin on pre-loved clothing. "This is sometimes the most fun we have in our workshop! There's something so gratifying about a quick project, and recycling well-made clothing. We are committed to sustainable retail, and understand the impact of high demands for cheap clothing in today's global market. Focusing on worn inventory allows us to lessen that demand while delivering high-quality items."

Events

Often, our events include a hands-on aspect or interactive component. RC features artists that teach guests a specific art technique, such as block printing, weaving, quilting, batik, etc. Preservation of hands-on art forms and indigenous/folk art techniques are the focus.  

In the past we have featured music performances, photography collections, and fashion shows/makeovers. This aspect of our space has the most versatility, and has the greatest reach in terms of connecting artists to other artists, and art to the public. It is our hope that we keep events free to all, especially since museums and other art spaces have become less accessible. 

What's Needed

The Bazaar has 3 aspects that create the foundation.

Retail, Design Workshop & Events. The funding goal for the space is $10,000 which will help:

  • Rent a space that is accessible to marginalized artists, located in a diverse area in Philadelphia. We are looking for a commercially-zoned space that is multi-use to accommodate both a retail section and design workshop/gallery.
  • Purchase store supplies, workshop equipment, displays, CRM & bookkeeping systems etc.
  • Cover overhead of utilities and business expenditures (licensing, insurance, fees, etc)

After establishing a hub in our community, we plan to expand:

  • Partnerships with university & trade schools to broaden our internship program, pathways with industry professionals for independent and emerging artists.
  • Entrepreneurship in a Digital Market Program for young creatives
  • International exchange program, connecting with and featuring other marginalized artists from around the globe; 4-10 week Design Residency in the US.
  • Art & Books Section, Regular Music & Storytelling events for families

The Impact

Your contribution will allow us to establish a space that will continue to grow and become an arts hub of its community. In a time where are art, independent designers, and marginalized groups are increasingly vulnerable, building this avenue is more than opening a store- it is establishing a stronghold of culture.  

While the workshop seeks non-profit status to continue serving the community, the retail aspect of our space will support the ongoing expenses of operation. Our team is composed of veteran artist entrepreneurs, with deep ties to youth empowerment. Be a part of the movement!

For supporting our work, we offer a range of original designs and fun packages that include:

  • clothing
  • accessories
  • gifts
  • art prints
  • custom works
  • special services from yours truly

This season, give the gift of creating change and investing in making art accessible!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, you can still help us get the word out! Connect us with your friends, family members and networks; a simple post or share can go a long way. You can also visit our website at www.rockerscloset.com and purchase many items directly from our online shop. Stay tuned to watch our progress in the campaign- we will be making updates!

OGNK~  all original art and apparel is the schtick. Our motto is “Go ahead, Be different!” Something that will hold true to our (and our fans’) true vision which is to not be afraid to break the mold of conformity and hyper normalization. 
OGNK features classic sportswear, original streetwear, headwear and accessories. All weather. All style. All day.
OGNK ~ The original spelling for the word "Organic"


Over 14k community volunteer hours with national and local organizations, and more than 6k classroom teaching hours working with underprivileged minorities, OGNK strives to support art in our communities through youth engagement
Our Story
We opened our doors in Philadelphia in 2011 on Fabric Row, and spent 3 years creating a burgeoning hub for artists, designers, and creatives in our city. We combined a powerful mix of retail, original designs created in our onsite workshop, and creative events.

Original store Sept. 2011
"Essentially you could come in, buy affordable clothing, have it altered in-store as a customer. Our selection featured curated vintage, thrift and original apparel. In our workshop, our free internship offered: design skills, access to equipment & resources, and an avenue to sell your designs directly to the public. The space often featured clothing & accessory designs of several rotating independent artists. In order to introduce a new designer to the public, we hosted launch events or open houses. During these events, guests could participate in live art activities, such as block printing. People came to shop as much as they came to learn about other artists, or participate in events or workshops. As we grew, people wanted more of it."
 



Arty Party June 2012
"To celebrate the launch of independent designers in our store, we hosted an Arty Party. In the June launch, guests learned to make African Print Bowtie Earrings, and created Tutu's from remnants of fabric."
 

Tattooed Moms, Philadelphia 2015. Photo by Courtnee Owens
Vision
We believe that creative & artistic endeavors should be accessible. Our goal to is to expand our current vision and open a larger space, Rockers Closet Bazaar, to continue our work. “We combine the sustainable practices of carrying handmade/original works, vintage, and thrift with creative initiatives. In a time where many artists’ work is co-opted with ease by commercial brands, we strive to designate a space that is dedicated to promoting original works in which marginalized artists have both visibility & creative control- RC Bazaar is an arts cornerstone of its community. “
What happens in the space
Retail
Independent original designs, curated thrift & vintage


Resident Designers OGNK, Elk Neck & " " continue to create the independent collections out of RC Bazaar. These collections are original design mainstays of our space.
OGNK
OGNK features classic sportswear, original streetwear, headwear and accessories.

 


Elk Neck
Elk Neck features handmade jewelry in bold yet simple shapes.



Uaminifu
Uaminifu features beautiful apparel prints, across adult, children's, and accessory collections.



RC Mini Collection for children
Gallery Classes
This aspect of our space creates a platform for teaching artists to bring industry skills to the public, preferably to young, QTPOC, and marginalized artists that have limited access to apprenticeships. Digital Market Design & Entrepreneurship, Apparel Design, Jewelry Making, Block Printing, Knitting, Screen Printing, Batik, etc.


Design Internships: 3 month program/apprenticeship that builds design & production skills with an entrepreneurial small-business approach. RC Bazaar is a partner with AIPH, Drexel, UPenn, & Temple Universities.
Jewelry & Metalworking Arts: Rotating guest designers lead workshops for the public that teach various skills & and techniques for creating jewelry, small sculptures, art.
Upcycling

Altering thrift and vintage apparel, a fresh spin on pre-loved clothing. "This is sometimes the most fun we have in our workshop! There's something so gratifying about a quick project, and recycling well-made clothing. We are committed to sustainable retail, and understand the impact of high demands for cheap clothing in today's global market. Focusing on worn inventory allows us to lessen that demand while delivering high-quality items."
Events

Often, our events include a hands-on aspect or interactive component. RC features artists that teach guests a specific art technique, such as block printing, weaving, quilting, batik, etc. Preservation of hands-on art forms and indigenous/folk art techniques are the focus.  

In the past we have featured music performances, photography collections, and fashion shows/makeovers. This aspect of our space has the most versatility, and has the greatest reach in terms of connecting artists to other artists, and art to the public. It is our hope that we keep events free to all, especially since museums and other art spaces have become less accessible. 
What's Needed
The Bazaar has 3 aspects that create the foundation.
Retail, Design Workshop & Events. The funding goal for the space is $10,000 which will help:

Rent a space that is accessible to marginalized artists, located in a diverse area in Philadelphia. We are looking for a commercially-zoned space that is multi-use to accommodate both a retail section and design workshop/gallery.
Purchase store supplies, workshop equipment, displays, CRM & bookkeeping systems etc.
Cover overhead of utilities and business expenditures (licensing, insurance, fees, etc)


After establishing a hub in our community, we plan to expand:

Partnerships with university & trade schools to broaden our internship program, pathways with industry professionals for independent and emerging artists.
Entrepreneurship in a Digital Market Program for young creatives
International exchange program, connecting with and featuring other marginalized artists from around the globe; 4-10 week Design Residency in the US.
Art & Books Section, Regular Music & Storytelling events for families




The Impact
Your contribution will allow us to establish a space that will continue to grow and become an arts hub of its community. In a time where are art, independent designers, and marginalized groups are increasingly vulnerable, building this avenue is more than opening a store- it is establishing a stronghold of culture.  
While the workshop seeks non-profit status to continue serving the community, the retail aspect of our space will support the ongoing expenses of operation. Our team is composed of veteran artist entrepreneurs, with deep ties to youth empowerment. Be a part of the movement!


For supporting our work, we offer a range of original designs and fun packages that include:

clothing
accessories
gifts
art prints
custom works
special services from yours truly

This season, give the gift of creating change and investing in making art accessible!  
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not able to contribute, you can still help us get the word out! Connect us with your friends, family members and networks; a simple post or share can go a long way. You can also visit our website at www.rockerscloset.com and purchase many items directly from our online shop. Stay tuned to watch our progress in the campaign- we will be making updates!

story:
1. DAD’S RUCKSACK

Expandable; can be used in 3 ways

Exterior pockets and adjustable straps for extra storage (bottle, picnic mat, yoga mat, tripod etc.)

Hidden panel inside to store items separately

2. MOM’S TOTE BAG

Perfect for grocery shopping

Foldable into a compact size

3. KID’S BACKPACK

Transforms into a bright green dinosaur

Light-reflective strip making it safe to use at night

4. PICNIC MAT

Ideal for a day out in the park

Mosquito-repellent* Coated with Anti-Mos™, invented by the Hong Kong Research Institute of Textiles and Apparel (HKRITA), the picnic mat safeguards you and your family from insects, making your day out more pleasant and bug-free! The anti-mosquito technology coats fabric with microcapsules loaded with insect repellent certified by Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) USA. It has been tested to effectively repel insects even after 70 washes.

5. USB CHARGE PORT

Charge your phone on-the-go and never be without battery again *Power bank not included

WATER RESISTANT

Water resistant = water fight-friendly

Hong Kong secondary school students: LoLo, Abby, Mandy, Ka-Sin and Inez (L to R)

Behind MFB 5.0 are 5 students from Shau Kei Wan East Government Secondary School in Hong Kong. MFB 5.0 was designed with passion, creativity and entrepreneurial spirit. It gave the students the unique opportunity to apply what they have learned in their ‘Technology and Living’ course and The Mills Summer Program, to a real-life project. The final result? A well-designed, thought-out product with the vision of bringing families closer together. 

How the student creators themselves would use MFB 5.0: 

LoLo: “Use MFB 5.0 to ascend all the summits in China!” 

Abby: “Enjoy the cherry blossom and autumn leaves season in Japan on the picnic mat.”

Mandy: “Carry MFB 5.0 to go picnic with my parents.” 

Ka-Sin: “Travel with my family through the vast Mongolian Grassland using MFB 5.0!”

Inez: “Take MFB 5.0 to Thailand and experience the culture!”

Headline, 18th May 2018

HK01, 15th May 2018

   Jumpstart Magazine,  15th May 2018

Ta Kung Po, 15th May 2018

Wen Wei Po, 15th May 2018

Mingpao Daily, 23rd Apr 2018

SCMP Young Post, 20th Nov 2017

Sing Tao Daily, 10th Oct 2017

It all began from idea generation…

To our very first sample…

To multiple prototypes…

Productive meetings…

Design modification...

Factory visit...

Campaign video-shooting…

TO THE FINAL PRODUCT!

The Mills Summer Program 2017   We were the winning team of The Mills Summer Program. Held in June-August 2017, the program provided students with the opportunity to explore their interests and build skills that put them on the path to success, giving them a real taste of the business world. 25 students from 6 secondary schools were given tours around leading corporations and met with designers, business partners, startups, NGO’s and professionals within the textile industry. Visits to workshops allowed the students to see first-hand the design process, paper pattern drawing and sewing techniques. The Program also taught students about business basics: product development, supply chain and production, sales and marketing. Mentoring was provided by The Mills Fabrica team, incubatees and professionals.

About The Mills The Mills is a landmark revitalization project by Nan Fung Group, a celebration of shared industrial legacy with Hong Kong, and a step towards a future of applied creativity and innovation. Announced in 2014 by Nan Fung Group on its 60th anniversary, The Mills project will transform and revitalize the company's former textile factory into a destination for innovation, culture, and learning. The Mills is composed of 3 pillars, each contributing a unique perspective and experience. 

  • Fabrica - A business incubator and springboard for techstyle startups and strategic partners 
  • Shopfloor - A landmark for experiential retail, an expression of Hong Kong's evolving character   
  • Centre for Heritage, Arts and Textile (CHAT) - A non-profit art centre interweaving textile arts, history and science The Mills is targeted to open in 2018.         

About The Mills Fabrica The Mills Fabrica is a business incubator, fund and space/lab for techstyle startups and strategic partners -- companies at the intersection of technology and style. Fabrica Incubator onboards startups with great potential and puts them through an intensive program of self-improvement, practical business guidance, and marketing exposure while Fabrica Fund invests in leading techstyle entrepreneurs creating the future. Fabrica is dedicated to co-creating techstyle startup success stories and a global techstyle community, a catalytic hub where new ideas spark and game changing collaboration takes off.

story:
Hi! I'm Claire Cassidy and I've been handcrafting fluffy glowing LED costume cat ears for humans purrfessionally for several years. I've sold them at comic cons, anime conventions and festivals up and down the west coast and shipped them all over the world. The number one request I get is for the ability to change the LED to any color, a feat previously technologically unattainable. Until meow. I've done it. I've finally done it! I've updated the LED design for this proven, well loved concept and I'm creating this campaign to spread glowing cat ears to the world in a larger quantity and at a lower price then I will ever be able to offer them later on, while still keeping them quality, handcrafted and purrfect!

So meow that you know they exist, don't you dare tell me you've never wanted glowing cat ears. I know better then that. And so do cats. And they are watching. 

Features

Color Changeable

The ears use bright, long-lasting LEDs that be can be set to 12 different solid colors, 1 slow color changing rainbow LED mode, candle flicker effect, and 2 different auto-turn off timer modes via the included remote. 

Remote Controlled

The ears are controlled by a discreet infrared remote control, and the color of the ears can be set either together or individually. One red one blue? Can do! One color changing one pink? Can do! All orange half the night and color changing the other half? Can do! Match ANY outfit or aesthetic! 

BUT WE'RE NOT DONE! On the back of the remote control is a shiny mirror-like sticker You can see your reflection in to check out what color you have changed the ears to once they are already on your head. It's super useful! 

Fluffy!

They are fluffy. That is all. Really freaking fluffy. Not molded plastic. No hard headband. No bulky battery pack. High quality faux fur. FLUFFYYYY!!! 

Clip-on

They clip on easily to your hair or any headband you like to wear (Or let's be super real a hat, your shoes, your beard or your friends beard work too. Options!). This is made possible by the largest, most durable alligator hair clips available! Have fine hair, no hair or like to headbang a lot? Clipping them to a soft or hard headband makes them just as secure as costume headband ears. 

Comfortable and Adjustable

Each ear has a hand-made wire frame that makes it easy to shape each one to your head, or bend the frame to change the batteries inside the LED more easily, or make the ears rounder or more pointed looking! They are easy to adjust right where you want them on your head, and most importantly without a hard plastic or wire headband they are COMFORTABLE!

Pitch/Call to action

Help me build my LED cat army and get this campaign meowt into the world! By funding this way I can buy all the materials and build them all at once in a streamlined fashion, allowing me to craft a lot more a lot faster than I normally could and with more focused attention. As a small business with tiny profit margins I normally can't afford to bring my prices down, but on this scale I can take $10  off and add in fancy packaging exclusively for this campaign!

Options

Fluffy White

  • Fluffy
  • White
  • Can see the LED through the entirety of the ear, making them absolutely stunning when lit up in dark environments.

Fluffy Black

  • Fluffy
  • Black fur outside, white fur front panel
  • LED can be seen clearly through the front, and dimly through the black fur back. Look awesome day and night!

Tech Specs

The batteries are easily replaceable due to my innovative design. Each ear uses 2 CR2032 coin cell batteries, which are standard and can be found easily in stores. Each ear has between 6 and 12 hours solid runtime, depending on which mode is being used. The LEDs are hidden inside of each ear, and can be accessed through the front panel of fur, which can be pulled open. They are turned on by twisting the top of the LED case to the left, and off by being turned right, you can also turn them on and off with the remote after they have been turned on manually initially. The remote takes 1 CR2032 coin cell battery and is replaceable. 

FAQ

Do I really need LED cat ears?

Yes. Shhhhhh....In your heart you know. Yes. 

Can I change the batteries?

Yes. EASILY. Boo yeah!

I don't have hair to clip them to.

That's why they come with a headband! Making them with clips just gives everyone more options, you can still clip them to any hard or soft headband and they will work just like costume headband ears.

Can the LEDs in each ear be individually changed?

Yep! You may need to hold one ear away from the other to get them to change separately but they are designed to do so. 

Will they rainbow color cycle?

Absolutely! There is a button that will make them slow fade color change through all the colors. It's stunning! They will also flicker gently like a candle flame. They will NOT blink though. No blinky flashing LEDs here. 

Why are they so expensive?

They aren't. They are handcrafted quality costuming art. You're welcome. 

Will you still sell your classic single LED color cat ears?

Yup! Same as ever! And at the same price as usual! This will just be a new epic option moving forward. 

Timeline and shipping

This campaign will run for 30 days and then I will start production. Goal for production is another 30-45 days, depending on the success of the campaign. Shipping goal is by mid-late August and the ears should arrive 3-10 days after that. 

Meow some realness. I am committed to quality and in order to achieve that I will stretch my shipping timeline a bit, only if needed. Will you get them remarkably quickly for a custom handcrafted design? Yes. Will I take a bit of extra time to work out any bugs that arise in the process of making them? Yes. I believe you will be so excited upon receiving them that this is not a purrblem. 

The ears will be packaged in a lovely gold box and includes a soft headband, remote control, batteries and instructions. 

Thank You

From the bottom of my heart. I chose years ago to pursue a living as a handcrafted artist and every customer, every bit of support, means the world and is what keeps me going. The fact that I have even gotten this far is completely pawsome and a dream come true!

story:
To Order a PowerWatch, please visit powerwatch.com

 

 

 

Unlike today's smartwatches which need to be recharged every day or two, the MATRIX PowerWatch never needs to be removed from your wrist for charging.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

After you showed us your overwhelming support on Day One of this campaign, we knew we just had to do something special to thank you. We're introducing the Black Ops Special Edition. Matte black from top to bottom. The watch bezel has a completely different surface treatment, with a specialty black anodization. It comes with a matching 22mm Milanese strap, woven from stainless steel, and specially treated to develop a deep black finish.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Introducing the Matrix PowerWatch X. It's the biggest, baddest, toughest smartwatch out there. It'll go four times deeper, with water resistance to 200m. Tough enough for the roughest of situations. Because it's bigger, it generates more power, so we've added a vibe and notifications.

 

 

 

 

 

Never Recharge

The PowerWatch runs off your body heat and when you take it off, your data is stored in memory and it goes to sleep; put it back on and the watch turns back on right where you left it. It's got a power meter that tells you how much electricity your body heat is producing.

 

 

 

 

Accurate Calorie Count

Your body turns the calories you consume into heat. The PowerWatch accurately measures the calories you burn using our advanced thermoelectric technology.

 

 

 

A Versatile Smartwatch

The PowerWatch is a rugged aircraft-grade aluminum smartwatch that wirelessly syncs with your smartphone, automatically adjusts to the current time zone, and has changeable watch faces. The PowerWatch tracks your activity and sleep and is water resistant to 50 meters so it's great for swimming.

 

 

 

Activity Tracking

Monitor your calories burned, steps taken and sleep quality at a glance. A button press will take you to micro-applications like a timer and stopwatch.

 

 

 

Customizable Watch Faces

Change the watch face to suit your mood.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The MATRIX PowerWatch wirelessly syncs with the MATRIX iOS and Android apps. The apps will show you how many calories you've burned, steps you've taken, and whether you're getting a good night's rest. It will even show you how much electric power you've produced during the day, weekly trends, all-time records, and will support Apple Healthkit and Google Fit. Share this data with your friends and setup competitions to see who can burn the most calories or generate the most power.

 

 

 

 

Our thermoelectric technology converts heat to electric power. It is based on the Seebeck effect discovered in 1821. In the absence of an applied voltage gradient V, electric current, J, can still be generated if there is a temperature gradient, T: . A thermoelectric material must have a low thermal conductivity and high electrical conductivity to function efficiently. NASA has used this technology to power the Voyager spacecraft and Curiosity, the mars rover.

A thermoelectric module is composed of many tiny semiconductor "legs" that when added together create a large voltage. 

 

 

 

 


After five years and numerous prototypes, the Matrix team is close to the finish line. Your funds will go to the production tooling necessary to manufacture the watch. We have already completed the design for manufacturing and all that remains is the production runs necessary to get the watch into your hands.

 

 

To reduce risk, we are working with a Hong Kong-based product development and manufacturing partner who has an excellent track record shipping millions of units of products, including some of the most successful wearable products on the market.

 

 

 

 

Matrix's team is composed of experts in thermoelectric material science, thermal engineering, and consumer product development and manufacturing. The core team consist of PhD graduates from Caltech, MIT, Harvard, and UCSD. Our manufacturing director has over 25 years of experience and has shipped millions of units for leading technology companies. 

 

 

 

 

Q: How does the PowerWatch accurately measure calories burned?

A: A calorie is defined as the amount of heat energy required to raise 1 gram of water by 1 degree Celsius. Scientists measure calories burned by measuring the amount of heat the body produces. This is the most accurate way of measuring calorie loss. The PowerWatch's thermoelectric technology measures calories burned in a similar fashion by measuring the amount of heat you produce.

 

Q: What happens when I take off the PowerWatch?

A: The PowerWatch goes to sleep and runs off battery power where it draws a tiny amount of current. Put it back on and it turns on with the correct time.

 

Q: How come I've never heard of thermoelectrics before?

A: Thermoelectric technology has been around for decades, but only in limited niche applications like NASA built spacecraft. With the recent advent of low-power electronics, we felt it was the right time to use our thermoelectric technology for a consumer product.
story_txt: To Order a PowerWatch, please visit powerwatch.com   Unlike today's smartwatches which need to be recharged every day or two, the MATRIX PowerWatch never needs to be removed from your wrist for charging.       After you showed us your overwhelming support on Day One of this campaign, we knew we just had to do something special to thank you. We're introducing the Black Ops Special Edition. Matte black from top to bottom. The watch bezel has a completely different surface treatment, with a specialty black anodization. It comes with a matching 22mm Milanese strap, woven from stainless steel, and specially treated to develop a deep black finish.       Introducing the Matrix PowerWatch X. It's the biggest, baddest, toughest smartwatch out there. It'll go four times deeper, with water resistance to 200m. Tough enough for the roughest of situations. Because it's bigger, it generates more power, so we've added a vibe and notifications.     Never RechargeThe PowerWatch runs off your body heat and when you take it off, your data is stored in memory and it goes to sleep; put it back on and the watch turns back on right where you left it. It's got a power meter that tells you how much electricity your body heat is producing.    Accurate Calorie CountYour body turns the calories you consume into heat. The PowerWatch accurately measures the calories you burn using our advanced thermoelectric technology.   A Versatile SmartwatchThe PowerWatch is a rugged aircraft-grade aluminum smartwatch that wirelessly syncs with your smartphone, automatically adjusts to the current time zone, and has changeable watch faces. The PowerWatch tracks your activity and sleep and is water resistant to 50 meters so it's great for swimming.   Activity TrackingMonitor your calories burned, steps taken and sleep quality at a glance. A button press will take you to micro-applications like a timer and stopwatch.   Customizable Watch FacesChange the watch face to suit your mood.         The MATRIX PowerWatch wirelessly syncs with the MATRIX iOS and Android apps. The apps will show you how many calories you've burned, steps you've taken, and whether you're getting a good night's rest. It will even show you how much electric power you've produced during the day, weekly trends, all-time records, and will support Apple Healthkit and Google Fit. Share this data with your friends and setup competitions to see who can burn the most calories or generate the most power.    Our thermoelectric technology converts heat to electric power. It is based on the Seebeck effect discovered in 1821. In the absence of an applied voltage gradient V, electric current, J, can still be generated if there is a temperature gradient, T: . A thermoelectric material must have a low thermal conductivity and high electrical conductivity to function efficiently. NASA has used this technology to power the Voyager spacecraft and Curiosity, the mars rover.A thermoelectric module is composed of many tiny semiconductor "legs" that when added together create a large voltage.     After five years and numerous prototypes, the Matrix team is close to the finish line. Your funds will go to the production tooling necessary to manufacture the watch. We have already completed the design for manufacturing and all that remains is the production runs necessary to get the watch into your hands.  To reduce risk, we are working with a Hong Kong-based product development and manufacturing partner who has an excellent track record shipping millions of units of products, including some of the most successful wearable products on the market.    Matrix's team is composed of experts in thermoelectric material science, thermal engineering, and consumer product development and manufacturing. The core team consist of PhD graduates from Caltech, MIT, Harvard, and UCSD. Our manufacturing director has over 25 years of experience and has shipped millions of units for leading technology companies.     Q: How does the PowerWatch accurately measure calories burned?A: A calorie is defined as the amount of heat energy required to raise 1 gram of water by 1 degree Celsius. Scientists measure calories burned by measuring the amount of heat the body produces. This is the most accurate way of measuring calorie loss. The PowerWatch's thermoelectric technology measures calories burned in a similar fashion by measuring the amount of heat you produce. Q: What happens when I take off the PowerWatch?A: The PowerWatch goes to sleep and runs off battery power where it draws a tiny amount of current. Put it back on and it turns on with the correct time. Q: How come I've never heard of thermoelectrics before?A: Thermoelectric technology has been around for decades, but only in limited niche applications like NASA built spacecraft. With the recent advent of low-power electronics, we felt it was the right time to use our thermoelectric technology for a consumer product.

story:
FreshersMag: "A combination of ultra-thin watch hands and short metallic indexes create a simple watch face. A variety of colors is available for the watch hands, case and straps allowing us to build a unique and affordable watch."

The Time Bum: "... the Pantiam gives you a Ronda 763, sapphire crystal, and choice of nifty calf leather straps with quick release bars at a bargain price."

Wrist Watch Review: "Valachio Pantiam is a slim three-hander at a nice price."

WatchIsThis: "In short, the concept of Valachio is not unique, but they do have an edge. For the price point of the Pantiam they offer a lot of quality and that makes their watch actually come out ahead of the pack."

Watch Bandit: "Well-made, luxurious minimalist watches tend to cost a small fortune, and those that are affordable either aren’t crafted to last or just aren’t comfortable to wear for long periods of time. Valachio Watches is seeking to change that and finally offer an alternative modern timepiece that is fashionable, functional and still affordable for the average man."

If you’re someone who appreciates clean watch designs, high quality materials and a fair price-tag, then you have come to the right place.  At Valachio, we believe in delivering products that are:

·  Quality - Made with high-quality, cost-effective materials that allow us to deliver watches built to last you a decade at a very reasonable price.

·  Simple - Achieving aesthetical success with a ‘less is more’ approach to product design. Using plain but lively colors in the selection of our watch hands and calfskin straps.

·  Affordable - Won't make a huge dent in your wallet!

We achieved simplicity by using unique design elements like ultra-thin watch hands and short metallic indexes to keep the watch face as clean as possible, while still allowing for precise timekeeping with individually marked minute ticks.


We blended a variety of colors for the watch hands, case, and straps; formulating a great selection of color combinations to accommodate your individualism.


The movement that powers the watch is undoubtedly the most important component of the watch.  With that in mind, we chose a Swiss quartz movement; Harley Ronda 763.  This reliable movement holds a battery with approximately 40 months (3 1/3 years) of battery life.  Replacing the battery takes no more than a few minutes with the proper tools and you can do it at home.


The watch has a diameter of 40mm and a lug width of 20mm.  This versatile design fits well on the wrists of both guys and gals.


Sapphire crystal glass is used as the face of the watch.  Sapphire is the 2nd hardest substance found on Earth, surpassed only by diamond.  This premium material makes the glass exceptionally resistant against scratches.


We used 316L surgical-grade stainless steel throughout the construction of the entire watch (body, caseback and screws) for maximum durability and resilience against the elements.  Ion-plating, a form of PVD plating is used as the plating process of Midnight and Sunrise.


A large and flat caseback along with curved sides make for a comfortable wearing experience. Battery changes and repairs are made accessible with a caseback that is held together with four screws, allowing for easy access to the quartz movement with a flathead screwdriver.


Valachio Pantiam comes with a water resistant rating of 5 ATM, meaning it should have no problems engaging daily tasks like washing dishes or surviving an unfortunate trip through the washing machine.


With your Valachio, you have the option between a calfskin strap or a stainless steel mesh strap. The straps are 87.5mm in length for the shorter section and 115mm in length for the longer section. They have a width of 20mm at the widest point.


Our leather straps are natural, vegetable-tanned full grain calfskin sourced from Italy.  They feel nice and soft to the touch and wraps comfortably around your wrist.  As they are made of 100% calfskin, they're extremely durable and also resistant against water.  They also smell pretty good... if you like the smell of leather.


Our stainless steel mesh straps are made of 316L stainless steel, the same material used in the construction of the watch itself.


We upgraded all of our straps to include quick release pins.  These pins allow you to interchange between straps in just seconds.  No more strap changing tools, just your fingernails and our quick release pins.


To receive additional straps with your watch, add the pledge amount specified in the pledge tier. You get access to 2 additional calfskin color options when you pledge for a separate strap; white and red.


If you pledge for an extra calfskin strap, you will be able to choose from any of the 3 buckle options.  Our buckles are also made from 316L stainless steel.


All Valachio Pantiams come with drilled lugs.  If the quick release pin malfunctions or if you want to use a third party strap without a quick release pin, you can remove the strap with a simple pushpin.  Our calfskin strap's buckle also come with a drilled hole, allowing you to swap the buckle for a different color, or replace it with a butterfly deployment clasp if you prefer.


Your Italian calfskin strap can accommodate wrist sizes from 14.5 - 21.25 centimeters.


With a flathead screwdriver, your stainless steel mesh strap can be adjusted to fit virtually any wrist size.

On the back of every Valachio, the month and year of the watch's production are imprinted, along with the production run number. Each watch will be serialized, along with the total number of watches manufactured in the production run.  This means your Valachio will be (just a little) unique!  Oh, and a bonus Lord of the Rings reference!

We're offering a total of 8 models for this Indiegogo campaign.  Our large variety means each Valachio Pantiam is better suited for a certain setting.  For example, we recommend the 'Sterling | Black Calf' for more dressy occasions and the 'Sunrise | Blue Calf' to go with casual attire.

You will choose your model(s) in a survey shortly after the campaign.  The strap is included with each watch you pledge for!

Silver hands | Polished steel case | Black calfskin strap

Silver hands | Polished steel case | Polished steel mesh

Green hands | Polished steel case | Brown calfskin strap

Green hands | Polished steel case | Polished steel mesh

Blue hands | Gold-plated case | Blue calfskin strap

Blue hands | Gold-plated case | Gold-plated mesh

Red hands | Black-plated case | Black calfskin strap

Red hands | Black-plated case | Black-plated mesh

We believe that a good presentation is important, but we did not want superfluous fancy packaging to add to the cost of your Valachio. With that in mind, we designed something that was simple, inexpensive and guaranteed to protect your watch during shipping.


The inside of the box is made from soft, white velvet; an aesthetically pleasing, cost-effective, and protective material.  Your Valachio will be inside, waiting patiently for her owner.

· Watch Diameter: 40mm

·  Watch Width: 6.8mm

·  Lug Width: 20mm

·  Swiss Ronda Normtech, Caliber 763 | 40 Months of Battery Life

·  Sapphire Crystal Glass

·  316L Stainless Steel Body | Caseback | Screws

·  14k Karat Gold Ion-plating (Sunrise) | Chrome Black Ion-plating (Midnight)

·  5 ATM Water Resistant

·  Full-Grain Italian Calfskin Strap | 316L Stainless Steel Mesh Strap

·  Quick Release Pins on All Straps

·  Drilled Lugs and Buckle

·  Assembled in Shenzhen, China

Your Valachio is covered by a 60 day refund policy.  Within 60 days of receiving the watch, you can send the watch back to us and get a full refund.  Visit the Refund Policy section of our website for additional information.

Your Valachio is also covered by a 1 year warranty against defects.  Visit the Warranty section of our website for additional information.

We decided to use a fulfillment center based in Shenzhen, China to deliver the watches to you. Here is a list of reasons affecting this decision:

·  Speed - After production and quality control, the watches will be transported directly to the fulfillment center and shipped.  This means we skip the process of bulk shipping, going through customs, and finally shipping your Valachio to you.  With this method, we significantly reduce the total delivery time.

·  Safety - With less steps in shipping the watches to you, there is a reduced risk of your shipment getting lost/damaged.

·  Cost - Since the watches will never be bulk shipped or go through customs, we avoid the import duties and bulk shipping cost.  This cost reduction translates directly into the price we can offer the watches to you.

·  Import Duties - There is a better chance of you not paying import duties.


After this Indiegogo campaign, we will use FBA (Fulfillment by Amazon) to ship all of our products so if you purchase anything from us in the future, it will be a speedy delivery!

Thank you for reading up until this point of our Indiegogo InDemand campaign.  We hope you love our watches as much as we do!  If you have any questions for us, free feel to contact us through any of these outlets:

·  Sending a message through Indiegogo

·  Emailing us at support@valachio.com

·  Reach us at any of our social media pages

Click here if you want to learn more about the team at Valachio!

Click here for Valachio's press kit.

We managed to successfully surpass our stretch goal of $20,000 CAD in the original Kickstarter campaign which means you now have access to one additional model, the Saltire!  It features a polished stainless steel case with blue watch hands.

With the Saltire, you will have the option between a blue calfskin strap and a silver mesh strap.

story:
The aquabook comes in five different colors you can choose from: clean lucent, bold blue, wild pink, fast green and dapper grey. The newest member of the aquabook family: aquabook - Gold Edition!

We ship worldwide without China.


With lots of dedication and love we have developed the aquabook that differs from every other water bottle ever produced: it is book-shaped, reusable and customizable. We want to support you to stay productive and strong - physically and mentally!

The aquabook combines convenience, design and sustainability - while keeping you hydrated and genius!

The aquabook genius formula: uniqueness = knowledge x style²

Staying hydrated is the key to performance, whether physical or intellectual - a lack of water is a lack of brainpower. Drinking eight to ten cups of water a day can improve your levels of cognitive performance by up to 30%. Therefore it is crucial to carry your water with you - wherever you are - whatever you do!
Due to its genuine A5 format it fits easily in your bag, purse or briefcase. The aquabook has a sleek design that perfectly matches your style. You can also combine your favorite aquabook and cap color freely to go along with your individual design. Make it YOUR aquabook!
Designed and manufactured in Germany, it is 100% BPA and BPS free and of course long lasting due to highest quality. We care about sustainability: did you know that 3 litres (100 fl. oz) of water is needed in order to produce an ordinary 1 litre (33 fl. oz) plastic water bottle? By using the refillable aquabook, you will not only reduce plastic waste, but you will also save a significant amount of water.



Go for gold! We’ve received a lot of great support so far and we want to say thank you with an eye-catching special edition you surely haven’t seen before:






The aquabook comes in five different colors and the special Gold Edition.




To ensure, you always carry your aquabook with style, we developed the aquabag. A drawstring bag, made out of jute and 100% organic cotton. Produced by women in India.


Our latest development: the neoprene sleeve in cyan or black with grey or white trim. The sleeve makes sure your aquabook is protected and isolates your drinks in any clime of the world.


Cleaning your aquabook is essential. We offer exclusive cleaning tabs and the aquabrush. These accessories will facilitate the cleaning procedure - ensuring that your aquabook is perfectly clean.


You can customize your aquabook the way you like it. We can print your favourite picture, pattern or statement even if you're only ordering one single aquabook. Making it your very own aquabook.







Even an aquabook is not completely free of CO2 emissions, but we ship all our shipments in a carbon neutral way.








Risks & Challenges

We are very confident that we will deliver your aquabook on time. We've spent a lot of time selecting the best production partners close to our premises and not somewhere on the other side of the world. That ensures better communication as we can personally check upon the progress. Nevertheless, unforeseeable problems can occur – e.g. a fire or shortages of raw materials. However, we will do everything we can to meet deadlines and we expect to even beat them, as we know how awful it is to wait for your newest acquisitions.
We will keep you updated on our progress every step of the way. Thus, if any difficulties occur, you'll be the first to know what is going on and what we'll do to address the problem. As a backer, you'll get full behind-the-scenes view of how we're progressing here in the aquabook labs.
When it comes to the product itself, our manufacturing partners and advisors combine more than 50 years of active blow molding experience and they are the best experts in their fields.
After producing viable prototypes we had various consultations with the raw materials manufacturer, so that we are sure that the aquabook and its accessories will be made on time and in the quality we - and you - demand.
We see our backers as our stakeholders and it's our #1 priority to meet your expectations. That's why we've chosen our advisory team very carefully with experienced colleagues that have already managed and shipped kickstarter campaigns successfully. Through that we want to ensure you, that even if problems occur we will be transparent in our communication, letting you know first hand about the campaign management and shipping.

We will keep you updated on our progress every step of the way. 
Thus, if any difficulties occur, you'll be the first to know what is 
going on and what we'll do to address the problem. As a backer, you'll 
get full behind-the-scenes view of how we're progressing here in the 
aquabook labs.
When it comes to the product itself, our manufacturing partners and 
advisors combine more than 50 years of active blow molding experience 
and they are the best experts in their fields.
After producing viable prototypes we had various consultations with 
the raw materials manufacturer, so that we are sure that the aquabook 
and its accessories will be made on time and in the quality we - and you
 - demand. 
We see our backers as our stakeholders and it's our #1 priority to 
meet your expectations. That's why we've chosen our advisory team very 
carefully with experienced colleagues that have already managed and 
shipped kickstarter campaigns successfully. Through that we want to 
ensure you, that even if problems occur we will be transparent in our 
communication, letting you know first hand about the campaign management
 and shipping.

story:
Opes Wallet

Simply put. The Opes Wallet offers protection, a minimalist style and top quality leather.

www.opeswallet.com

"The new standard for a                                            SLEEK & STUNNING wallet"


"It's stylish and the quality is fantastic. I truly can't believe I've been lugging around a huge wallet in my back pocket for all of these years"



4 Limited Edition Opes Wallets


"Zeus"


"Apollo"

"Luna" 

"Ares"

*All Wallets have an inside pocket to store cards or cash*

Size Matters

The Opes Wallet is designed to carry just as many cards as a regular wallet. The minimalist wallet can carry anywhere from 1-10 cards and the cash you require for the day, at a fraction of the size. Gone are the days of a "bulky brick" in your back pocket.

       


RFID Protection


Protecting one’s credit card information from theft is hardly a new or revolutionary concept. Given the emergence of RFID ‘tap’ technology embedded within modern credit cards, passports and other secure access cards makes one's personal and sensitive information extremely vulnerable.

Let us show you how an "Electronic Thief" would compromise your information:



Cards at Risk:

  • Credit Cards
  • Debit Cards
  • Passport Cards 
  • Enhanced Drivers Licenses
  • Transit Cards
  • Access Cards

**Each card slot in every Opes Wallet is individually tested to ensure RFID protection is enabled**


                              



Our Name: "Opes"

Opes (pronounced “oʊpəs”, with a similar phonetic sound as “open” but with an “s” instead of an “n” at the end) is a Latin term used to refer to wealth, riches and resources, and that is what my business is all about. The safekeeping of your personal riches and sensitive information in the form of a minimalist, yet high quality wallet that can adapt to the needs of every man around the world. Sticking with the Latin theme, our wallets are named after the famous Latin/Greek Gods!

        

Delivery

We anticipate that you will have your wallet(s) in JANUARY 2015.

Our Foundation


Hi, my name is Nick Findler, The Founder of the Opes Wallet! I truly see business as the ultimate platform to address issues that are close to my heart.

Between the ages of 6-9, I was Sexually Abused repeatedly by my stepfather and from personal experience, I know that the proper support systems are not in place to help children going through the same excruciating pain that I've felt. I know how long and hard the road to recovery is and I've made it my mission to help these victimized children, and I invite you to join me on this mission. 

You can learn more at littlewarriors.ca

$5 from the sale of every wallet will go towards the Little Warriors Foundation, which supports Sexually Abused Children.

The Be Brave Ranch is a place where victimized children and their family can go to receive mentorship and help to see that there is a bright future at the end of the tunnel.


FAQ

Q: How will you know what wallet I want to purchase?
A: Once you have purchased a "perk" that includes at least 1 Opes Wallet, we will then reach out to you for your exact order.

Q: How do we know that the wallet protects against "Electronic Theft"?
A: Our manufacturer uses a long-range RFID reader (HID R90) to test each pocket of the wallet individually.  If you would like to test it yourself, place an RFID enabled card anywhere in your wallet. When you make a purchase with a paypass machine, try swiping the wallet over top of the payment machine, if the transaction does not complete, your wallet is secured.

Q: How do we know proceeds are actually going to the Little Warriors Foundation?
A: At the conclusion of the campaign and once the contributions have been received, we will be posting the donation and the amount that is received by the foundation.

If you have any other questions, please feel free to email: nfindler@opeswallet.com

story:
Belts are the centerpiece of your outfit, yet the style hasn't changed in 50 years. It's time we take belts up a notch. 

One belt purchased= $2.00 to charity.


NOTE: Estimated delivery is DECEMBER 2014.

Sizing: We are cutting these belts to order. The best way is to do is measure a belt you own from the end to the hole you wear it on - give us that measurement. Don't include the buckle in that measurement! For our women's waist belts measure around where you want to wear it. 

We launched our website BeltCraft.com a year to bring men great options when it came to belts. Now we want to offer you more stylish American-made leather accessories by expanding into Women's belts and also new products such as watch straps and wallets. We need YOUR help to expand our production capabilities and make this dream possible. With the proceeds from this campaign we want to:
  • Buy our hides and buckles in bulk to increase production efficiencies
  • Buy new tools to produce WOMEN'S belt styles.
  • Produce and stock straps, loops, and buckles to offer you A-LA-CARTE belts where you can interchange your buckle or loop. 
  • Design and produce pre-made new styles every month with lower prices for you.

As we say, "You may not be able to customize everything in life, but we make it possible to customize your belt." 

1. TOP-QUALITY, MADE-IN-USA CRAFTSMANSHIP

We use full-grain leather vegetable tanned in Italy and calf suede. Our colors are made through a drum dye process - no "painted" leather here, which means no cracking. And of course, all of our belts are made in the USA using machines that date back 50 years. 



2. WE SELL DIRECT SO YOU ARE PAYING FOR QUALITY, NOT RETAIL MARKUPS

When you buy off the rack belts, they are marked up over 5-8X from time of production. We sell direct to you giving you more flexibility with your style and saving you from paying multiple mark-ups by retailers. You pay for quality and that's it.

3. UNLIMITED OPTIONS 

We have more belt colors and options than anyone else. You can send us a photo of your shoes, suit or dress and we will help you design a belt to perfectly match. Through this campaign we are launching our new belt design with Chicago screws. Now you can buy options a-la-carte and change out the buckles and loops when you want to. The freedom to change all parts of your belt is at now your fingertips (well, maybe with a little help from a screwdriver):

4. WHEN YOU BUY OUR BELTS, WE DONATE TO 2 GREAT CAUSES
Since our campaign is going on in October & November we wanted to support Breast Cancer Awareness Month (October) and the Movember Foundation's awareness for men's health (November). Every little bit counts. For every belt that sells we are donating $2 to charity. Here is where your donations will go:



To help us achieve our goals, we want to offer you something in return. We're launching our NEW styles exclusively through our Indiegogo campaign via our Perks and at a discount. Drumroll please......


THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU! At the end of the campaign our founder Mo will send you a Thank You video. Plus you will receive a discount code for 10% off a future purchase on our website. Every bit counts and your donation will make a huge difference. 
*** Your unique discount code will be emailed to you.


Exclusive, new style. A slim waist belt perfect for dresses, pants and to mix & match (see perk #9). You don't have to worry about matching your jewelry with this style.
Details: Full-grain vegetable tanned leather or calf suede (slate and cobalt) . Fastened with 3 snaps in the back so you can adjust the size throughout the day. No stitch.
Width: 3/4" wide
Colors: Brown (leather), Red (leather), Slate (suede), Black (leather), Cobalt (suede)
*** We will send you an email to choose your color.



A perfect casual belt with contrast stitching. This belt represents the colors of the "Movember" foundation, plus it just looks really cool.
Details: Full-grain vegetable tanned leather belt with contrasting stitch
Width: 1.25" (standard) width
Colors: Matte navy leather with orange stitch
Buckle: Burnished silver square roller



Chukka boots are those suede boots that almost every man owns and wears during the fall. We usually see guys wearing a generic brown leather belt with these boots so we created a belt to match. Plus, the belt is the perfect width to fit in the loops of your jeans.
Details: Calf suede drum dyed with matching stitch
Width: 1.5" (jeans / casual) width
Colors: Peanut suede with tan stitch.
Buckle: Burnished gold square roller



New Women's Belt Style with Chicago Screws so you can mix & match! Customize your belt on BeltCraft.com - there are 50+ options available in our new women's style. At the end of the campaign we will send you a code to design your belt at Beltcraft.com. Includes an extra buckle or loop of your choice! If you ask us we think its twice the quality of those "Hermes" or "Feragammo" straps, but for a fraction of the price. Perfect for jeans or with work pants. 

Sizing: Be sure to take a belt you wear and measure it from the end to the hole you wear it on. Subtract 3" from that measurement and that is your size!
** women's styles can be seen on our website at the end of the campaign


Details: Full grain vegetable leather or calf suede (navy) with white stitch
Width: 1.25" (standard) width
Colors: Tons of options to choose from on BeltCraft.com! See the bottom of the page for sample color options.
*** We will send you an email with a code after the campaign to design your belt.



Our men's belts are new and improved! You can change out your buckle or loop at with ease because we use Chicago Screws to secure the belt. Customize your belt on BeltCraft.com - there are 50+ options available. At the end of the campaign we will send you a code to design your belt at Beltcraft.com. Includes an extra buckle or loop of your choice! 



Details: Full grain vegetable leather or calf suede with matching stitch
Width: 1.25" (standard) width
Colors: Tons of options to choose from on BeltCraft.com! See the bottom of the page for sample color options.
***We will send you an email with a code after the campaign to design your belt.


TWO BELTS, FOUR WAYS. Choose any two waist belts from perk #2. Exclusive, new style. Color options are below. For sizing, measure around where you would wear the belt.
Details: Full-grain vegetable tanned leather or calf suede (slate and cobalt) . Fastened with 3 snaps in the back so you can adjust the size throughout the day. No stitch.
Width: 3/4" wide
Colors: Black (leather), Brown (leather), Red (leather), Slate (suede), Cobalt (suede)
*** We will send you an email to choose your colors.


Choose any TWO belts from Perk #2 - Perk #8. Trust us, once you receive one, you'll want to come back for more! Get the exclusive discount while it lasts.
***We will send you an email after the campaign to choose.


Choose any FIVE belts from Perk #2 - Perk #8. We've seen our repeat business and you'll want to get one while the discount lasts!
*** We will send you an email after the campaign to choose.


Get 10 belts custom designed to your specifications. You can choose the style, stitch color, buckle, loop... YOU NAME IT. The design needs to be the same for all belts but the sizes can be different. You can also go in with friends on this!!


Are you a brand looking for a gift for your employees? As part of a uniform? Need some belts to carry in your store? To merchandise with your product? We can do that and brand them with your logo no problem! The 20 belts should be the same style but can obviously be different sizes!


We are going to work around the clock to make your belts. Sometimes our suppliers are unexpectedly out of some materials which causes a delay in our production. Although we will be informing everyone in advance, some things are out of our control. We have other suppliers we can reach out to for materials if anything were to happen. 

We are going to try our BEST to get these out before the holidays so that you can gift these belts. Occassionally things come up that are out of our control. Rest assured, Mo will be in the shop working 24/7 making sure your belts are shipped on time.


Looking for a creative way to help BeltCraft, but don't have the funds to purchase yourself one of our perks?

  • Spread the word! Be a good friend - don't let your friends get caught with their pants down.
  • Know an editor or blogger who might like our product? Let us know! We always appreciate referrals. Email us info@beltcraft.com.
  • With the holidays coming up don't forget this makes a great gift!
Sample Women's Buckle Styles:


Sample Men's Buckle Styles:


Sample Loop Color Options:


Thank you for your support!!
Mo
Founder, BeltCraft.com
