The Nanofilters cleans the air you breathe. The ViralOff®️ treatment (the same as on är Gloves) has a self-cleaning function.
 

 
 What's in the BoxEvery pair of är Gloves comes with an är Doypack. är Doypacks have been designed to keep out all light, dust, water, air and odors. This provides an ideal environment for your är Gloves when you are not using them.  Production in EuropeAll our production is based in the EU. We monitor every detail of the production process to make sure it meets our quality standards. Frequently Asked Questions Can I clean my är Gloves?Yes, of course, but we recommend washing the gloves as little as possible so that they can retain their unique properties provided by the ViralOff® treatment. For best performance and sustainability, wash only when absolutely necessary, by hand with gentle soap and lukewarm water. How do I know my är Gloves will be the right size?You can check out the size guide above. är Gloves are elastic, so we recommend measuring your hand correctly. If the gloves are too big for you, this can cause problems with using touch-screens. How do I store the är Gloves when I am not using them?Keep är Gloves in a dry and clean environment away from direct sunlight. For best results, use the original resealable container that came with the gloves. är containers have been designed to keep out all light, dust, water, air and odors. This provides an ideal environment for storing the är Gloves. Within two hours, the gloves will clean themselves, thanks to ViralOff® technology. Do är Gloves protect me from getting infected?är Gloves are made of cutting-edge technologies such as ViralOff® and Eco Acqua Zero™, but we cannot guarantee that you will not get sick. Are the är Gloves appropriate for medical use?Even though we think the är Gloves are pretty spectacular, we do not recommend using them in hospital settings as a protection of the members of various health teams, as they are simply not suitable nor made for such use. Most medical gloves are disposable, single-use gloves but the är Gloves are designed to be worn by people to use in everyday life. It is, therefore, inadvisable to wear the Gloves if you are in frequent contact with infectious patients. The är Gloves should not be considered a medical product under any circumstances. Do you offer worldwide shipping?Yes, we offer shipping to all countries. Does your product contain or come into contact with latex?är Gloves are made entirely without latex.

story:
Introduction

Hi, welcome to my very first crowdfunding campaign! This is so exciting. 

I am Marianne "Mau" Simmelkiær, a Danish designer based in the Greater Copenhagen Area of Denmark. I have been part of the fashion industry for 25 years, for good and for bad. 

As a designer, I have seen first-hand how the diversity of fashion expressions has skyrocketed over the years, only to lower the overall quality of the fashion industry, put pressure on the production facilities, confuse the end user and explosively increase the amount of waste we leave in landfills.

As one who has contributed to this massive style-inferno in my early days as a designer, I now feel obligated to suggest an alternative. 

An alternative to "fast forward fashion".

 

My mission

The alternative I offer is the EnCourage Philosophy, revolving around the EnCourage Suit supported by a small range of longlasting EnCourage products. The design must be timeless and the quality high, the products must be functional and make you feel strong, beautiful and comfortable at the same time. The EnCourage products are designed to ease your everyday life, to help you minimalize your wardrobe and encourage you to live a simpler life. 

I've decided to put first things first and try to leave a small, but important footstep in the history of Fashion. Will you join me on my mission? The more we join, the stronger a movement and a bigger, more remarkable footstep we will leave!

 

What would you do if you could get perfectly equipped and dressed in 30 seconds every day? Meditate? Learn French? Or just sleep in?

 

 

The product: The EnCourage Suit

The EnCourage Suit is a one-piece suit that balances aesthetics, quality, functionality and comfort in an elegant and innovative way. It will kickstart your feeling of freedom from the accelerating fashion cycles – and get you out of the door faster. 

The suit is versatile and perfect to wear for work, cocktail parties, morning meditation sessions, picking up the kids and playing with them afterwards. Also suitable for grocery shopping or enojying a quiet espresso, all alone in the sofa. 

 

Design composition 

The design composition of the EnCourage Suit ranges from a classic tailored jacket that frames your face beautifully, to futuristic, functional solutions such as a stretchable zipper and the basic comfort of a natural, breathable fabric. 

Its straight shoulders are underlined as in classic tailoring to create a balanced silhouette. The sleeves have tailor tricks embedded, which make the upper arm appear slimmer, and cupping the top sleeve close to the shoulder also adds to a well-balanced silhouette. The sleeves are slightly (approximately 3 cm) longer than standard sleeves.

The suit has a stretchable zipper around the waistline for a practical opening – or for dividing the suit into two separate items. One EnCourage Suit makes three different wearables! With EnCourage, restroom visits while wearing a one-piece will never again cause a panic attack. 

The Encourage Suit is constructed to let you walk, bend and sit freely. The waistline is low, offering flexibility in torso-length when sitting and is adjustable in circumference by the stretchy fabric. You'll be surprised how well it fits different body shapes!

The waistline can be tightened with a flat lace trim connected at centre front. The body of the suit is slim-looking, but with ease, to keep it feeling comfortable in use.

Pantlegs are kept in straight lines for elegance. They have a visual slimming effect with comfortable (stretchy) slimness at the hip, grading into a slightly wider bottom hem. The EnCourage Suit has 4,5 cms of adjustable length at the bottom and has a unique "galoche detail", so you can look beautiful in both high heels and sneakers, just by using a simple snap button technique. The pants have stitched press folds to remain elegant, through daily use.

Five functional and elegantly integrated pockets on front hip, chest and wrist mean you always have your most needed items close by. Just leave your handbag behind when leaving the office to get your caffeine fix! Your phone and keys are kept safe, locked in by a quality zipper on your lower front. Hip pockets keep your small and random pickup items handy (and your hands warm on cold days). And last, but not least: Your credit card and subway ticket are safely located on your wrist - always conveniently at hand! Literally. 

Also by hand, but tone-in-tone, small and beautifully hidden, I have placed a small Chinese sign of the Sisterhood you join, by acquiring a suit. Only those in the know will know of the little detail, that has great importance to me and hopefully soon to you too.

The one-piece construction of the EnCourage Suit is made from an exclusive merino wool fibre – ensuring an overall comfortable temperature by balancing heat and cold vertically.

 

Colour

The EnCourage Suit will be launched in a sophisticated charcoal grey - that compliments all skin tones and creates an elegant contrast to all hair colours - and in a limited early bird edition of black.

 

100% Merino Wool

The suit is made of 100% Merino, the world's finest wool fibre.

Wool is a natural fibre obtained from sheep and has many wonderful benefits: Thanks to this fibre, the EnCourage Suit has antibacterial and antimicrobial features and is both static and wrinkle resistant.

It is dirt repellant, flexible, breathable, soft, durable and has a great ability to regulate body temperature – it even keeps you warm when wet! It absorbs odours, too, so forgetting your deodorant at home is no longer a catastrophe. 

Simply put, merino wool is comfortable to wear and easy to care for.

 

Production sample preview video 
 

What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for €50.000 to start up EnCourage as a sustainable business.

The fashion value chain traditionally requires a much larger sum to kickstart, as the minimum quantities in the production of garments are high and reserved for established companies only.

 

Why crowdfunding? 

There are several reasons I have chosen to rely on crowdfunding, but basically, it is because I think that this is where my project belongs.

I identify with the strong positive values I believe belongs to the crowdfunding concept and my design philosophy is based on values which do not include a massive turnover - hence the concept is not attractive to banks nor business angels. And even if offered a loan, my mission would still be to spend funds on fibres and craft - not on mortgage and marketing plans.

In short: I want to share the process of making user-friendly clothing and I am carefully avoiding the usual process of the fashion industry - I wish to see where crowd-forces may lead the outcome! 

 

Budget breakdown

  • €16.000 Production of 200 EnCourage Suits - the very first batch
  • ~ €9.050: Worldwide shipping of suits and perks with carrier (~ estimate)
  • €8.500: Perks - development, samples, production
  • €6.700: 450 extra meters of 100% best quality Merino Wool for perks (= future EnCourage wearables)
  • ~ €4.000 Indiegogo and banking costs (if I reach my goal of €50.000 ~ costs are proportional to income)
  • €3.600: Packaging - design, development and production
  • €950: Webshop, -server, -host, online advertising (1 year)
 

= Total of ~ €48.800

 

… which leaves €1.200 for unexpected extra expenses

 

Any extra income above €50.000 will be spent on 2nd batch EnCourage Suit production and development of future EnCourage wearables.

 

What you get

  • membership of the EnCourage Sisterhood community
  • the possibility of getting first access to high-end high-quality products at an exclusive first mover price
  • lovely and functional perks for you to enjoy!
  • free worldwide shipping
  • transparency in business and production process
  • personal and kind contact and customer support by me personally - I want you to be happy!

 

 

The Impact

I want to empower women and take clothing to a new level. My passion is clear, but I can’t fulfil my mission completely on my own. I wish to collaborate with you - and hopefully, make a strengthening EnCourage Sistership community arise across the Globe. This, simply because I believe that teamwork makes a better world.  

Crowds can do magnificent things together. I want to open up the process of making user-friendly clothes through a shared anti-fashion-production. A successful, crowdsourced user-loving (anti-)fashion-object might just inspire the industry to re-think current practice!

 

The EnCourage vision

We want fewer products - but of higher quality - on the market in the future.

We want to take pressure off the production facilities - without lowering their end income. We want to minimize the amount of fully functional garments, that are left as waste in landfills.

We want to make Fashion less confusing for the consumer, by raising the overall quality of the fashion industry, slowing down the fashion cycle and remove reasons of bad conscience associated with clothing.

We want to promote smart living, simple living. “Looking good” shall no longer take up energy that is better spent on life empowering activities.

 

Possible challenges 

There are some limitations that could prevent the suit from creating the desired effect on a universal level:

 

The Suit and the message

The design of the EnCourage Suit is versatile, but not universal.

It is designed from a western (resourceful) perspective - and with the western feminine beauty ideals in mind -  to simplify life, and in most cases, it will only be able to solve this task for individuals living in this (or a similar) environment, that many perceive as stressful. The EnCourage message must, therefore, be understood from a western perspective. 

The material and proportions also limit its universality: It does have temperature regulating properties, yes, but a merino-onesie will still not be suitable to wear in areas with a very warm climate. It will not cool you down and not necessarily simplify your life, if you live in the Philippines or Kenya (unless you work in very A/C cooled offices, of course).

However, I and the EnCourage Sisterhood promise to invite designers elsewhere on this planet to cover their longitude with smart and long-lasting, sustainable designs.

Share our design manifesto and vision to help us do so!

 

Production & delivery risks

Since the suit is only one small step away from mass production (200 pieces is a mass, although a very small one in a fashion context, right?), we are luckily over many of the major risks that may arise in a design process.

Since I haven’t held the final production sample in my hand yet (I will update you and show you images as soon as I do!) there’s still a tiny risk, that the production could be delayed. I do, however, feel confident that we will follow the production plan and start the production on time.

A production contract is already signed and I will push the ‘produce’-button no matter what. This Indiegogo campaign is therefore set with ‘flexible goal’ and you will receive your order, no matter how close to the crowdfunding goal you take me.

As all products and most perks require shipping, there is a small risk that they will not be delivered on time. To this is added, that they are expected shipped around Christmas, our professional carriers’ busiest time of the year. I will, therefore, put an extra effort to prepare everything possible for shipping, while I wait for orders and suits to arrive from the production house.

I will keep you updated: You, our followers and crowd are our kings and queens and my mission is to keep the process transparent.

You show trust in me when helping me fund the EnCourage project and I promise:

I trust in you and your power, and I will do the absolute best I can to meet your expectations and deliver the best product. On time.

 

 

Your contribution

With your contribution, we can change fashion life for those interested and start a movement, created by the EnCourage Sisterhood community, towards a world with more alternatives to fast forward fashion.

Worldwide changes might not happen overnight, but I hope that we with our honest effort can make a difference by reaching each other and others, who want to do fashion differently. And by, hopefully, encouraging other designers to create more garments that are based on sustainable aesthetics and actual user needs - not on short-lived fashion tendencies and quick income opportunities.

Let’s do our best to leave a noticeable footstep in the history of Fashion.

No contribution is too small (nor too big;)): From €1 to €50.000, all sizes of contributions are regarded as kind gestures towards making Fashion a different game!

 

Like, share & THANK YOU

I am deeply grateful that you have been willing to read along. Thank you!

I hope that you feel encouraged to join the movement by making a donation and hanging in for updates and feedback (from you to me!) - and to share our project and the EnCourage Philosophy with your friends!

Join me on Facebook, Instagram and sign up for my Newsletter and be the first to get updates, insights and exclusive offers in your inbox (I will not spam you).

 

 

[ɑ̃kuʁaʒ]

or

[en-kur-ij, -kuhr-]

 

... Are you still wondering how to pronounce EnCourage?
​Try with your best french and I'm sure you will get it right!

story:
The Nor Cal Story

Almost five years ago Nor Cal Fight Shop set out to create a style that was rooted in the Northern California fight scene:

  • Sponsoring local fighters and events.
  • Visiting local gyms.
  • Establishing our Brand

Now we want to go to the next level!

Order one pair of shoes and get 20% off a future purchase!

A different code will be generated for each pair of shoes ordered:

  • Sixty orders will get us the minimum we need for manufacturing. The more we sell the more we can do to bring the store to the next level so we can serve the Bay Area and beyond!
  • We've already had more than one customer express interest in buying multiple pairs so we're hoping to hit the 500 unit max!
  • If we for some reason fall short of the goal of sixty pairs, we can still fill your orders. This campaign is going to help future products currently in development so the real goal is 500.

The Future

People outside the Northern California fight scene are showing interest in our brand:

  • Patricky "Pitbull" Friere wore our logo in his victory over Benson Henderson at Bellator 183.
  • We'll be sponsoring Mohammed "King Mo" Lawal at Bellator 199 in San Jose.
  • This is San Francisco's only Fight Shop and people from all over the world visit when they vacation here.

Fulfillment

The people who are making these shoes have been around for some time.

  • Shoes should ship to the shop within two weeks of the end of the campaign.
  • The more orders we get the more likely there will be minor delays in shipping once the product reaches the store.

Spread the word

Tell your friends:

  • Share this campaign on social media.
  • Visit the shop if you're in the area!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Exo Is Ready For The Future. Are You?

Made to last a lifetime and operate with upcoming technology, Exo is more prepared for the 21st Century than any other available wallet.

We are now producing Exo in weekly batches, join our campaign today! 

In A Changing World, Be One Step Ahead 

Streamline your lifestyle and secure your information with Carbon Exo.

Want To Keep It Minimal? 

Choose Minimus!

Minimus - Slim Stylish Secure. Store *5-7 cards internally, cash and extra cards in the back. Classic Carbon function.

Need More Storage?  

Choose Maximus!  

Maximus - More Storage - Less Mess. Store *5-7 cards internally, more options, more security. Just more all round. With Maximus, you've got more space than ever before for anything you want to store. Cash, coins, keys, SD cards, SIM cards and so on.

Ergonomic Ejection. The newly designed internal mechanism features our classic button, incorporating an all new ejection method.  

Quick To Use. With Exo, you don't need to take your card out of your wallet to pay. Simply eject, select and tap!  

Pay Securely. Designed with Chip & PIN in mind, keep your cards securely in your wallet while you pay. Eject, select, insert, type, done!

On The Move? Just Touch & Go. Maximus features a quick access RFID active pocket. When closed, your cards are secure, to activate simply open the back panel and your contactless card is now active.

Easy Access To Cards. Quickly get to your most needed card when required (pro tip: keep it at the back).

Room for the extra bits - Maximus features a secure internal pocket to store coins, keys, SIM cards... You get the idea!

Use Exo The Way YOU Want. Exo is designed to be as flexible as possible. If you're travelling, store multiple currencies. Photographer? Store your SD cards. Housesitting? Store the key safely inside.

Available In Many Different Finishes. Choose from four leather finishes and four different lining options. You'll be able to specify your choice in the post campaign survey.

Free custom engraving - We can engrave anything up to 20 characters, so get creative!

This great looking piece of kit is something we’re so confident in, we’re giving you a lifetime guarantee. 

If you live another 100 years, and we hope you do, Exo will be there for you and so will we (not 'we', more like our descendants or something).

Minimus - Choose your reward now, then fill out your leather and engraving options in our post-campaign survey.

Maximus - Choose your reward now, then fill out your leather, lining and engraving options in our post-campaign survey.

Carbon Signature - Upgrade your standard Exo to a signature for free! Incorporate a stainless steel or gold plate into your wallet for extra swag!

RFID Skimming - Some scanners are now powerful enough to penetrate standard aluminium shielding in wallets and steal data.

The leading RFID blocking wallet - Carbon Exo offers TWICE the protection of other wallets on the market. Our carbon leather acts as a second barrier, with the aluminium and stainless steel structure creating an impenetrable shield to safe guard your data.  

We live in a world of ever changing and expanding technology. Contactless payments dominate. Card clash is on the rise. Identity theft is an ever-increasing threat to our personal security. Carbon Exo is tackling these problems directly. 

Exo has security, usability and durability at its core. RFID safe when you demand it, responsive when you require it. We set out to make a wallet for the modern world that works with you, not against you. Store your cards and cash. Keeps cards and cash secure.

Unlimited choices for personalisation. All contained in a remarkable wallet unlike any other. Take the next step towards a more secure, easier future. Get Exo today.

You asked for - more secure storage, RFID interaction and greater durability. 

Exo delivers just that. 

With all of the trimmings - With Exo, you’ve got at least five cards inside, double the RFID protection as standard, more storage on the reverse for your small items, personalisation, a more durable body than ever before AND a lifetime guarantee.

Thank you! - We just wanted to take this opportunity to thank everyone in our original Carbon campaign for helping to design the Exo wallet. We couldn't have done it without you!

Three years ago, we introduced the world to Carbon, our first minimal wallet. 

We subverted the traditional wallet style and helped usher in a new era of accessory design. 

For years, we carried around bulky, floppy, leather or canvas wallets that were full of stuff we didn’t need. This dead weight was dragging us down. 

So we thought: why carry on this way? That’s why we made Carbon. 

Cut down on the clutter, keep your valuables safe and look good while doing so. 

Over the past 36 months, you guys have been asking us for certain features, new developments and highlighting potential changes to Carbon.  

It’s been a long process but now, at last, we’re in a position to deliver with Carbon Exo.

Variations - These will be available to choose in the post campaign survey, for the Minimus, only the leather will be available.

 

Stand out from the crowd - Not for the faint of heart, choose Midas if you're at least a level 12 swag master.

There’s a great deal of industrial heritage in our native homeland, Yorkshire. Sean, Peg and Ryan are all Yorkshire folk,  and James’ has nearly passed the naturalisation process. Sean’s upbringing in an area renowned for its rich textile history and Peg and Ryan’s steel and coal production combine to give a unique Yorkshire view on Vanacci products. James’ injection of Italian finesse rounds the edges off three Northern reprobates.  

We take a great deal of pride in what we do and we want you to see that pride every time you take your wallet from your pocket and every glance at your watch. Some companies only test a small percentage of their products. We test 100%. We made these. We’re not sending something out that we aren’t happy with.  

It’s not all been success and fun but there’s a great deal of satisfaction in building our own products, leaving each day with sore hands and dirty clothes. Each burn of the hot stainless steel. Each shock from electroplating. Every time we glue our fingers together is all worth it for the finished product: a combination of cutting edge manufacturing and old-fashioned, hand-made, blood, sweat and tear soaked craftsmanship.

From left to right - Ryan, James and Sean

 

Risks and challenges

After seven highly successful Kickstarter campaigns, we're very much accustomed to the running and fulfilment processes that come with crowdfunding.

We have arrangements in place with Royal Mail and FedEx as our shipping partners to distribute worldwide, with shipments currently occurring every working day.

As we now produce Carbon items daily, we are set up to create the new Exo range. While running our previous seven campaigns, we still operated our regular day to day business, distributing large numbers of parcels daily. Our partnerships with Royal Mail and FedEx allow us to control all our shipping in-house with daily collections from both couriers.

story:
Our Story

When Oana first started designing it was just a hobby, but her passion grew and she ended up in NYC at Parson’s School of Design to turn her interest into a skill. Now she has thousands of ideas sketched out and 30 ready to wear items. Her aptitude for choosing fabric textures, colors, and also the novelty of her cuts has turned into a beautiful line of clothing. The idea of creating a brand of beautiful, high quality, and comfortable clothing for women exciting in itself, but the added element of customizing each piece to its wearer offers women more space for self-expression and assures a perfect fit by eliminating the problem of unreliable sizing.

Alana is an American expat, a successful entrepreneur in Romania, passionate about life, art, and people. She joined the team as creative support and social media management. 

WANNA shows the beauty and spirit of the strong woman in each of us: no matter how challenging or fortunate her present moment, she is grounded in her inner identity, which she expresses to the world through vibrant color, soft textures, extravagant shapes, leaving a strong impression.

Our funding goal includes everything we need to get our company off the ground, introduce new collections, and create beautiful styles for you!

 

What You Get

We appreciate each and every contribution, no matter how big or small. We have a colossal dream and we know it!  We know not everyone is able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help out!

  • We appreciate any time you make some noise about our campaign!
  • Remember the Indiegogo share tools! ;)

REWARDS

- $10: Handwritten thank you note. We so appreciate your support!

 

- $50: One custom-made cardigan: colors available on request

- Production: Nov. 2018

- Quality control: Dec. 2018

- Delivery: Jan. 2019

 

- $100: Options:

1 custom-made skirt : colors available on request

1 custom-made  blouse: colors available on request

- Production: Nov. 2018

- Quality control: Dec. 2018

- Delivery: Jan. 2019

 

- $170: custom-made knit sweater: colors available on request

- Production: Nov. 2018

- Quality control: Dec. 2018

- Delivery: Jan. 2019

 

- $300 or more: one entire outfit (1 skirt of your choice from pic. A + 1 blouse of your choice from pic. B + 1 cardigan of your choice) : colors available on request

- Production: Nov. 2018

- Quality control: Dec. 2018

- Delivery: Jan. 2019

 

Risks & Challenges

Creating an entire collection on our own from beginning to the end will be an elaborate but beautiful journey. We are newcomers to the industry, which is daunting but we are eager to learn through our venture.

We created the current collections in Romania, where we have both been managing other businesses. Collectively, we have substantial experience with administrative and bureaucratic aspects and are hoping to expand these skills now in fashion. On the creative side, Oana has been preparing for such a project for the past 10 years and already has thousand of collections in mind and on paper.

The biggest challenge for us in Romania has been the fabrics; acquiring them is difficult and expensive, due to poor quality-price ratio. To address this concern, while allowing us to develop a larger business presence and expand our network in the industry, we plan to launch the business in New York City, where we have access to all the resources we need.

Our Goal

- Start-up company taxes in US, NYC – $20,000

- Space to rent in US, NYC - $10,000 $/month (necesary for 3 months- about $30,000)

- Two employees - salaries+taxes – about $25,000

- Price for the fabrics for next collection: about $5,000

- Storage equipment, technical equipment, accessories for tailoring, etc: about $20,000

Total: $100,000

story:
Hi there!

 

We are a group of fashion marketing students in our final year at Northumbria University in Newcastle working very hard on our final collections and products.

Our plan is to take all of our lovely work down to Graduate Fashion Week in London and set up a lovely stall in Earl's Court to showcase all of our hard work. Hopefully this will help us all get one foot into the fashion world and possibly even some job offers! So, as you can tell this is a really important opportunity for us and we'd like it to be the best stall there!

This is where we need a bit of help....

To do this we need to raise at least £4,000 to help pay for the cost of hiring the space, transportation and most importantly the printing and distributing of our book containing everyone’s work.

We have already worked really hard and managed to raise £1,200 ourselves but need help from lovely people like you to help raise the rest. Your contributions will be completely anonymous and you can donate as much, or as little as you wish.

Your kindness will be hugely appreciated and will help towards promoting and launching creative new talent into the fashion industry.

 

Thank you!

story:
Project Description

Arbo bracelet is a beautiful, unisex accessory with a mission. For every bracelet sold, we will plant one tree! So instead of getting just a cool, modern bracelet, you will get a tree of your own. Or if you are buying a gift to someone, now you can get a present that has more meaning than just a piece of jewellery.

Every year 81,000 km2 of forest gets cut down for various reasons. That is the size of Belgium and Netherlands together. At this rate of deforestation there will be no rainforests in 100 years. This is completely absurd when you take into consideration the fact that the trees are by far our best "technology" to combat global warming. 

What we hope to achieve with this campaign is to raise enough funds to order the materials needed to assemble the bracelets, and get this project going. We calculated that for the initial batch of bracelets we need at least $5,000 dollars. Everything that comes over the top is a bonus. 

In these modern times, when we live faster than ever before, sometimes it is hard to stop and take a look around yourself. If we did that more often, we would understand how some of the choices we make, make no sense. We, as a group of people who are bound by this project and hope to make it into a successful company, are on a mission to give our contribution to saving the planet from overheating and saving some of the natural habitats for wild animals. Join us on this road and wear a cool bracelet! :)

The Bracelet

Our bracelet is handmade with care and materials that do not harm the nature. The artificial leather blends perfectly with the copper tree medallion, that has been chromed. In time, the medallion will oxidise and return to its natural colour. The bracelet does not require any maintenance, however, it is recommended to avoid direct contact with water. 



The packaging and the instruction card that is within are made out of paper. Please recycle them once you have received the bracelet. 


Risks & Challenges 

If we reach the targeted pledge, the production part should not be too difficult. We have already handmade the first "test batch" and the process is straightforward. 

We already spoke to the company WeForest which will plant trees (first planting space will be in India), for all the bracelets purchased worldwide. Since we are Serbian, from all the bracelets purchased in our country we will plant the trees ourselves in partnership with local governments (prior to starting this project we planted 200 trees already - which is how we got this idea in the first place).

There might be an issue with shipping, since we are sending products from a non EU country to EU or to the US (or any other country). However, after consulting with the officials from the Post Office, we got the listing to shipping costs to all the countries according to the weight, and we got their reassurance that this type of product is not problematic to transport. 

We would like to think that we have the entire process which is to take place after a successful Indiegogo campaign planned out. If anybody has any suggestions we are here and open for positive critique.

story:
WWW.ROXFORDWATCHES.COM

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Roxford is a beautifully designed, high-performance hybrid smartwatch that chooses to keep its smarts more clandestine with a fully functional fitness tracker built discreetly into the strap. 

Cardiff Design's health app wirelessly communicates with the tracker, analyzes and displays your activity, and provides motivation throughout the day.    

Three aerospace engineers were inspired to develop a device that could adapt to any situation - casual, professional, or sport. That's why each Roxford comes with four interchangeable bands and a sleek travel case, so you can easily customize the look and feel of your watch on the go.

​

 

 

Aesthetically simplistic and sophisticated, the Roxford preserves a timeless minimalism that is both versatile and highly functional. From the hands down to the circuit board, our watches are built with style, comfort and quality in mind.  

 

 

 

Most smartwatches on the market put the tracker in the watch face. We designed the Roxford with the smart technology inside the watch buckle. Our patent-pending design helps distribute weight evenly around your wrist for balance and comfort. 

 

 

 

The Roxford tracks your steps, calories, distance and even your sleep patterns at night. It automatically collects activity data as you go about your daily life. It's so subtle, no one will notice you're even wearing a fitness tracker. 

 

The Roxford interacts with your smartphone via Bluetooth, allowing you to concentrate on your workout, get a restful nights sleep, or give that big presentation at work. Review your daily activity with our easy-to-use mobile app. 

+ Syncs with Apple Health, S Health, Fitbit and more...

Each Roxford set comes with 4 interchangeable straps. We designed our watches to transition seamlessly from day to night, from work to the gym. Dress it up for a fancy night out, dress it down for a run. The choice is yours. 

 

The wrap-around Silicone Air strap converts the hybrid watch into a traditional fitness band by removing the watch face altogether.  

 

Our ergonomically designed straps feature quick-release pins that let you switch styles while on the move, in seconds.

 

With six removable links (three on each side) you'll be able to easily resize the strap with a screwdriver (included) to fit your wrist.  

 

You'll be able to control aspects of your phone by simply tapping the device. Triple-tap to play/pause the music playing on your phone. Double-tap to skip to the next track. 

Additional gestures will be added in the coming months during development! 

 

 

 

  1. The Roxford hybrid smartwatch
  2. Four quick-release bands:
    • 316L Stainless steel
    • Premium leather
    • Silicone
    • Silicone Air (wrap-around)
  3. Compact travel case (take bands on the go)
  4. Magnetic USB charging cable
  5. Small screwdriver 

 

Cardiff Design, Inc., was founded by Nick Hallet, an aerospace engineer based in San Diego, California. With a passion for design and electronics, and a deep love for watches, Nick decided to follow his dream of creating a truly unique device. Since its inception, Cardiff Design has grown into an incredible team of engineers, craftsmen, and software developers. The team is motivated by blending exceptional technical design and high-quality components to help everyone move more, sleep better and improve their overall health.

 

 

What's Next?


 

 

Q: Why should I contribute to the campaign early?
A: We’re giving special pricing incentives to those who contribute early. As the days go by, our perk pricing will gradually increase. So the earlier you make your contribution, the more money you’ll save!

Q: I already backed the campaign. How do I choose my style?
A: We want to give you as much time as possible to choose the style that’s right for you. Once the campaign is over, we’ll contact you via email to finalize your selection(s).

Q: Can I contribute to more than one perk? For instance, can I buy two of the ROXFORD X2?
A: Absolutely! You can fund multiple perks (as separate transactions) and keep track of them in the ‘My Contributions’ section of your Indiegogo account.

Q: I backed the ROXFORD X2 perk. Can I mix and match Men’s and Women’s watches?
A: Absolutely. At the end of the campaign, we’ll contact you via email to confirm which size(s) you want and the particular style for each.

Q: Can I take it in the water?
A: Yes, and we hope you do! The analog watch has a water resistance rating of 10 ATM (100 meters) and the fitness tracker of 5 ATM (50 meters).

Q: What does the wrap-around Silicone Air strap do?
A: It’s a special strap that only attaches to either side of the fitness tracker, without the watch face. This makes it a lightweight fitness device that’s perfect for running or sleeping.

Q: Is the strap length adjustable?
A: Yes, we’ve included a small screwdriver with every set, so you can add or remove steel links on either side of the buckle as needed.

Q: What width are the straps?
A: Men's: 22mm, Women's: 18mm

Q: Is there a warranty?
A: Absolutely. We want you to be completely happy with your purchase, so each Roxford comes with a 2 year warranty against manufacturer's defects. We will repair or replace it for free.       

Q: Is VAT and import duties covered in the cost?
A: No. Cardiff Design cannot be responsible for import tax duties imposed by your country. 


Q: Does the fitness tracker measure heart rate?
A: There is no heart sensor in the device, but we may offer a simple upgrade in the future.

Q: Do you offer wholesale pricing for retailers?
A: Yes. Please email us at info@cardiff-design.com and we’d be happy to explore the possibilities.

Q: Is your invention patented?
A: It is currently patent pending (Utility).

Q: How do I ask a question that’s not on this list!
A: We welcome all questions that come to mind in the COMMENTS section. Just post a comment and one of us will get back to you ASAP :)

 

 

Thank you!

 

Our watches are already scheduled for mass production next month! Please share our campaign, and thank you for backing us.
story_txt:
WWW.ROXFORDWATCHES.COM       The Roxford is a beautifully designed, high-performance hybrid smartwatch that chooses to keep its smarts more clandestine with a fully functional fitness tracker built discreetly into the strap. Cardiff Design's health app wirelessly communicates with the tracker, analyzes and displays your activity, and provides motivation throughout the day.    Three aerospace engineers were inspired to develop a device that could adapt to any situation - casual, professional, or sport. That's why each Roxford comes with four interchangeable bands and a sleek travel case, so you can easily customize the look and feel of your watch on the go.​  Aesthetically simplistic and sophisticated, the Roxford preserves a timeless minimalism that is both versatile and highly functional. From the hands down to the circuit board, our watches are built with style, comfort and quality in mind.     Most smartwatches on the market put the tracker in the watch face. We designed the Roxford with the smart technology inside the watch buckle. Our patent-pending design helps distribute weight evenly around your wrist for balance and comfort.    The Roxford tracks your steps, calories, distance and even your sleep patterns at night. It automatically collects activity data as you go about your daily life. It's so subtle, no one will notice you're even wearing a fitness tracker.  The Roxford interacts with your smartphone via Bluetooth, allowing you to concentrate on your workout, get a restful nights sleep, or give that big presentation at work. Review your daily activity with our easy-to-use mobile app. + Syncs with Apple Health, S Health, Fitbit and more...Each Roxford set comes with 4 interchangeable straps. We designed our watches to transition seamlessly from day to night, from work to the gym. Dress it up for a fancy night out, dress it down for a run. The choice is yours.  The wrap-around Silicone Air strap converts the hybrid watch into a traditional fitness band by removing the watch face altogether.   Our ergonomically designed straps feature quick-release pins that let you switch styles while on the move, in seconds. With six removable links (three on each side) you'll be able to easily resize the strap with a screwdriver (included) to fit your wrist.   You'll be able to control aspects of your phone by simply tapping the device. Triple-tap to play/pause the music playing on your phone. Double-tap to skip to the next track. Additional gestures will be added in the coming months during development!    
The Roxford hybrid smartwatch
Four quick-release bands:
316L Stainless steel
Premium leather
Silicone
Silicone Air (wrap-around)


Compact travel case (take bands on the go)
Magnetic USB charging cable
Small screwdriver 
 Cardiff Design, Inc., was founded by Nick Hallet, an aerospace engineer based in San Diego, California. With a passion for design and electronics, and a deep love for watches, Nick decided to follow his dream of creating a truly unique device. Since its inception, Cardiff Design has grown into an incredible team of engineers, craftsmen, and software developers. The team is motivated by blending exceptional technical design and high-quality components to help everyone move more, sleep better and improve their overall health.  What's Next?  Q: Why should I contribute to the campaign early?A: We’re giving special pricing incentives to those who contribute early. As the days go by, our perk pricing will gradually increase. So the earlier you make your contribution, the more money you’ll save!Q: I already backed the campaign. Once the campaign is over, we’ll contact you via email to finalize your selection(s).Q: Can I contribute to more than one perk? For instance, can I buy two of the ROXFORD X2?A: Absolutely! You can fund multiple perks (as separate transactions) and keep track of them in the ‘My Contributions’ section of your Indiegogo account.Q: I backed the ROXFORD X2 perk. At the end of the campaign, we’ll contact you via email to confirm which size(s) you want and the particular style for each.Q: Can I take it in the water?A: Yes, and we hope you do! We will repair or replace it for free.       Q: Is VAT and import duties covered in the cost?A: No. Cardiff Design cannot be responsible for import tax duties imposed by your country. Q: Does the fitness tracker measure heart rate?A: There is no heart sensor in the device, but we may offer a simple upgrade in the future.Q: Do you offer wholesale pricing for retailers?A: Yes. story:
Allmade was founded by a group of screen printers who believe there is a better way to make a shirt.

2 billion t-shirts are produced every year, using fibers like industrial cotton, which is often grown in regions with minimal regulations—directly exposing workers and the environment to deadly pesticides and herbicides that are outlawed in the U.S.

These materials are then transported across the globe using bunker fuel, a heavy oil residue so toxic most countries won’t let ships use it within 200 miles of shore.

They are then spun into yarn, knitted into fabric, and sewn into garments by workers, some of whom are children, in sweatshop conditions, for a wage that does not allow them to meet even their most basic needs. In countries like Haiti, this translates to an increase in orphans, many of whom’s parents were forced to give them up because they couldn’t afford to care for them.

All of which allows a handful of large manufacturers to sell the blank garments at a low, wholesale rate to screen printers, who then sell t-shirts with printed designs to consumers.

The increased cost of sustainable materials often prevents screen printers from offering better choices to their customers, many of whom are unknowledgeable about the conditions under which their shirts are made—resulting in a pattern of exploitative production.

At Allmade, we’ve decided it’s time to change the pattern. And we need your help.

Founded by Ryonet, a leading distributor of screen printing equipment and supplies, and ten leading screen printing shops—Allmade believes there is a better way to make a shirt.

We are launching a new t-shirt line that is:

Made from sustainable natural fibers & recycled bottles.

Our tri-blend shirts are constructed of organic, U.S. cotton; polyester produced from recycled plastic bottles (3 bottles per tri-blend shirt that never make it to a landfill); and modal, a fiber from sustainably-farmed beech trees. Our cotton is grown in Texas, and spun, knitted, dyed and finished in the Carolinas, funding American jobs and reducing shipping pollution.

Made in Haiti, for a living wage that keeps families together.

We’ve partnered with the Global Orphan Project to create dignified living-wage jobs at their GOEX production facility—paying Haitian makers 5x the typical wage to cut and sew Allmade shirts. Many of these workers will be graduates from a new transition program designed to enable orphans who are aging out of the system for success, giving them valuable life and job skills.

Made to give screen printers, and consumers, a better choice for a better shirt.

We’re putting our collective expertise and purchasing power to work, educating the market, while offering screen printers and consumers a better option. Our high-quality blank t-shirts are produced at a competitive price, making it easier to make a socially and environmentally-kind choice.

 

We are looking to raise capital to purchase materials, and fund the initial production run. Your backing will directly contribute to the creation of new jobs in the U.S. and at the Allmade/GOEX factory in Haiti, supporting living wages that keep families together, and programs that care for orphans.

More importantly, it will help us change the pattern of exploitative garment manufacturing, creating consumer demand for shirts that feel better to buy and to wear.

Each shirt you buy will:

Together, we can make it better.

There are a number of ways you can help Allmade change the pattern. We’re offering perks in the following categories.

Blank Allmade T-Shirts

With over 100 years' screen printing experience on the Allmade founder's team, we made sure our shirts are the perfect blank canvas for designers, but they also stand on their own. Make your own statement in 100% organic cotton or our soft, luxurious tri-blend, or get one of each!

We will contact you when the campaign closes to collect your size and color preference.

Limited Edition Designs 

Screen printed by one of the Allmade founding shops, these designs are only available as Indiegogo perks.  Printed on our recycled poly/organic cotton/modal tri-blend shirts, we will release a new design each week in limited quantities. Wear a piece of history!

See the Updates section for this week's design!

Shirt color is set. We will contact you when the campaign closes to collect your size.

 

Allmade Screen Printer Perks

We want to provide like-minded screen printing professionals an environmentally and socially conscious option they can pass along to their customers, and a way to join the movement and help change the pattern of exploitative garment manufacturing. 

Screen printers can order a sample pack of all our cuts and colors, or sign up for the Early Adopter program and get early access to Allmade inventory. 

Allmade Experience Perks

Step into the world of screen printing and apparel manufacturing with one of our unique travel and education perks. Learn to screen print at one of our Screen Print Experience classes nationwide, or join a founding partner in their shop for a day.

Travel to South Carolina and tour the facilities where our raw materials are spun into yarn and woven into fabric. Or go all-in and join the Allmade team on one of our trips to Haiti, where you will see first-hand the good work The Go Project is doing with garment workers and orphans. 

Name An Allmade Color!

Eternalize yourself, your company, or your brand by naming one of our shirt colors. Only six colors available, and once they've been named they're gone. 

 

The GO Project is a non-profit global organization that contributes 100% of their donations to orphan prevention and care programs in impoverished regions.

Children in countries like Haiti, where the average worker earns a mere $3/day to support a family of 8, are at a high-risk of becoming economic orphans. The typical orphan in Haiti is not without parents, but rather without parents who can afford to care for their most basic needs—food, shelter, clothing, education, and basic healthcare. 

The GO Project is fighting this cycle, with:

Orphan Prevention Programs

The GO Project’s Haitian facility, GOEX, where Allmade shirts are produced, is among a number of businesses and ventures they’ve developed to create dignified work that keeps families together. 100% of GOEX’s profits are dedicated to orphan care.

Orphan Care Programs

The GO Project provides orphan care in 20 countries around the world, including Haiti, working with local churches to ensure their most important needs are met, and they are enabled with tools for success within their own communities.

Transition Programs

The GO Project recently launched the GO Transition Academy to give orphans between 18-24 (who have aged out of the system) valuable life and vocational skills for a successful transition into adulthood. Many of the makers producing Allmade shirts will be participants of this new, two-year program.

 

Allmade's founding partners are in a unique position to drive awareness and interest for their own product. A screen printing supplier and ten leading screen printers across the country, we purchase hundreds of thousands of t-shirts annually to sell to printers as blank canvases, or to customers as printed shirts.

We also have a unique ability to influence the apparel marketplace, by suggesting a socially and environmentally conscious alternative to our customers - who often are unaware of the exploitative nature of t-shirt manufacturing.

Twenty minutes on Google will teach you everything you need to know about the environmental damage done by cotton, plastic, and the profit-first practices of the apparel industry. But the Allmade story starts when we traveled to Haiti together.

We experienced first-hand the economic and environmental devastation endured by garment workers and realized what a positive impact we could have by creating dignified living wage jobs that empower the proud people of Haiti to take care of themselves and their families.

We returned wholly committed to breaking the cycle of poverty and child abandonment in Haiti while reducing our industry’s impact on the environment. We will do this first by making high quality, fashionable shirts that are a pleasure to print on and wear, and then by leveraging our industry influence to make Allmade a brand consumers ask for by name.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm jonnie austen. I've been designing streetwear since 2005. In that time I've designed full collections, capsule collections, one-offs and collabos for other brands and designers. Now I'm finally ready to launch my own brands.

I've designed 3 streetwear brands, pono streetwear - a brand that brilliantly portrays Hawai'i's urban street scene, sk808 skateboards - a skate brand that reprazents the Hawai'i skate scene just as zoo york reps the nyc skate scene, and ka'imi HI - my brother ka'imi's north shore Hawai'i surf brand.

Your contribution will enable me to produce enough samples to show to retail buyers so that I can get my brands into retail stores and into the collections of streetwear fans everywhere.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise a minimum of $500 to produce enough samples for each brand to show to retail buyers. Your contribution of $5 or more will help me to reach my funding goal.

As soon as I receive everyone's contribution I'll place the print order with a Hawai'i screen printer that I have standing by ready to produce my samples.

To thank you for your contribution you'll be able to choose from our awesome collection of tee shirts and stickers. I've created three capsule collections of ten tee shirt designs each. You can choose as many tee shirts as you want depending on the amount of your contribution!

The Impact

By contributing to my project you'll become one of the first to wear the awesome tees I've designed especially for this project. As one of the first to rep my brands you'll automatically receive a special perk that no one else can get. In addition to the tees and stickers you'll receive for your contribution you'll also receive 40% OFF ALL MERCHANDISE BOUGHT FROM MY ONLINE STORE FOR ALL OF 2013!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute to my "Holiday Steez Collection" campaign you can still help me reach my funding goal by sharing my campaign with your friends and followers using the Indiegogo share tools!

However you're able to help my campaign reach its funding goal you'll still be well rewarded. If you're able to get your friends and followers to contribute to my campaign and they identify you as the person who told them about it you will receive a sampler of stickers from all three of my brands and you'll also receive the 40% discount on all merchandise bought from my online store for all of 2013!

story:
WE ARE FASHION REVOLUTION

An Open Letter to all you Fashion Revolutionaries out there.

On 24th April last year, 1133 people were killed and over 2500 were injured when the Rana Plaza factory complex collapsed in Dhaka, Bangladesh - social and environmental catastrophes won't stop unless we act fast.


Picture of the collapsed factory in Dhaka. Photographer: Rahul Talukder

Fashion Revolution is about building a future where an accident like the Rana Plaza factory collapse never happens again. We believe knowing who made our clothes is the first step in transforming the fashion industry. Knowing who made our clothes requires transparency, and this implies openness, honesty, communication and accountability. 

              

It’s about re-connecting broken links and celebrating the relationship between shoppers and the people who make our clothes, shoes, accessories and jewellery – all the things we call fashion. 

                                       
                                       Photographer: Keiron O'Connor 

The huge success of Fashion Revolution Day globally this year (no. 1 trend worldwide on Twitter with  #insideout and 6.6 million clicks on Google on the day) is testament of how much was done to encourage transparency throughout the supply chain.

We couldn't have done this without you; and want to continue to use your power, people power, to fund our progress for 2015. We know that we have only scratched the surface this year and if we want to be bigger, stronger and better next year (and every year) we need funds. 

Your money and your donations are our independence, the only way that we can operate freely, to say what we want and do what we want. 

Of course, we are calling on brands and organisations to support us, but we want to be in a position to call our supporters our "partners" and not our "sponsors". That way we can maintain our unique voice, and follow our own agenda.

This is what your money will mean to us:

- 2 full time staff members (and interns) to tackle the challenges ahead for the 2015 campaign.

- Resources for our website (regularly updated news and contents; liaising with producers to create videos and blog posts for our "meet the makers" section; create branding for the 2015 campaign theme; develop tools to facilitate communication throughout the entire supply chain).

- Creating new visuals, such as films and photographs illustrating best practice by brands that are pushing the boundaries, all over the world, to showcase their work and increase their reach.

- We need funds to reach further into education, involve and visit more schools and colleges, lecturing and communicating our message.

- We need another fashion shoot showcasing the brands that are making a difference and another celebrity shoot, this time on an international scale, to ensure continued global press coverage.

- Provide free education and online resources for the Fashion Revolution global community (62 countries and growing).

- Ensure our presence in all the international Fashion Weeks.

We have begged and borrowed to make Fashion Revolution Day happen; our team in the UK, and all other teams worldwide, have worked tirelessly - overtime and through the night, giving time, calling on all personal networks and contacts - and everything that you have seen so far, all the amazing support, all the initiatives, every single event, was initiated by passion and commitment.

Our Global Advisory Committee have all used their means and considerable influence to help us spread the word and create change, instigating events and encouraging support.

This is the first time in history that everyone who wants to see a more sustainable future for fashion has come together, and although Fashion Revolution Day is just one day a year, the Fashion Revolution movement now needs to grow, and keep asking the questions, because we don't have the answers - yet.

Visit this link to see all the countries involved so far, the people involved and events for each country:  Fashion Revolutions Global Community and Events

There are now an unprecedented number or of individuals and organisations working together to share the same message. You can see some of the organisations on this link: Fashion Revolution Day Friends

Please help us to make 2015 Fashion Revolution Day even more spectacular.  With your help and your donations, we will reach further and wider, independently, and consolidate the incredible momentum that we have generated so far.  Fashion Revolution Website


Our perks include t-shirts made by survivors of the Rana Plaza disaster

T-shirts made by survivors of the Rana Plaza disaster. The factory Oporajeo was setup after the Rana Plaza disaster in 2013 to create job opportunities for the survivors from the disasters.   They make perfect gifts with an incredible story.

   
(We will contact you to get colour and size information after your buy the perk)

We also have vouchers from the wonderful eco fashion brands below

                

                                            

Links to designer websites:   Pachacuti Made Jewellery   Little Green Radicals  L'Herb Rouge   Komodo   A Beautiful Story  69b   KibootsFrom Somewhere   Authur and Henry   Pants to Poverty  People Tree  Bibico


Picture of Pants to Poverty you can buy with our voucher - fabulous!

fashion industry. Knowing who made our clothes requires transparency, and this
implies openness, honesty, communication and accountability.               It’s about re-connecting broken links and
celebrating the relationship between shoppers and the people who make our
clothes, shoes, accessories and jewellery – all the things we call fashion.                                                                               Photographer: Keiron O'Connor The huge success of Fashion Revolution Day globally this year (no. 1 trend worldwide on Twitter with  #insideout and 6.6 million clicks on Google on the day) is testament of how much was done to encourage transparency throughout the supply chain.We couldn't have done this without you; and want to
continue to use your power, people power, to fund our progress for 2015. We
know that we have only scratched the surface this year and if we want to be
bigger, stronger and better next year (and every year) we need funds. Your money and your donations are our independence,
the only way that we can operate freely, to say what we want and do what we
want. Of course,
we are calling on brands and organisations to support us, but we want to be in
a position to call our supporters our "partners" and not our
"sponsors". That way we can maintain our unique voice, and follow our
own agenda.This is what your money will mean to us:- 2 full time staff members (and interns) to tackle the challenges ahead for the 2015 campaign.-
 Resources for our website (regularly updated news and contents; 
liaising with producers to create videos and blog posts for our "meet 
the makers" section; create branding for the 2015 campaign theme; 
develop tools to facilitate communication throughout the entire supply 
chain).- Creating new visuals, such as films and photographs 
illustrating best practice by brands that are pushing the boundaries, 
all over the world, to showcase their work and increase their reach.-
 We need funds to reach further into education, involve and visit more 
schools and colleges, lecturing and communicating our message.- 
We need another fashion shoot showcasing the brands that are making a 
difference and another celebrity shoot, this time on an international 
scale, to ensure continued global press coverage.- Provide free education and online resources for the Fashion Revolution global community (62 countries and growing).- Ensure our presence in all the international Fashion Weeks.We
 have begged and borrowed to make Fashion Revolution Day happen; our 
team in the UK, and all other teams worldwide, have worked tirelessly - 
overtime and through the night, giving time, calling on all personal 
networks and contacts - and everything that you have seen so far, all 
the amazing support, all the initiatives, every single event, was 
initiated by passion and commitment.Our Global Advisory Committee have
 all used their means and considerable influence to help us spread the 
word and create change, instigating events and encouraging support.This
 is the first time in history that everyone who wants to see a more 
sustainable future for fashion has come together, and although Fashion 
Revolution Day is just one day a year, the Fashion Revolution 
movement now needs to grow, and keep asking the questions, because we 
don't have the answers - yet.Visit this link to see all the countries involved so far, the people involved and events for each country:  Fashion Revolutions Global Community and EventsThere
 are now an unprecedented number or of individuals and organisations 
working together to share the same message. You can see some of the 
organisations on this link: Fashion Revolution Day FriendsPlease
 help us to make 2015 Fashion Revolution Day even more spectacular.  
With your help and your donations, we will reach further and wider, 
independently, and consolidate the incredible momentum that we have 
generated so far.  Fashion Revolution WebsiteOur perks include t-shirts made by survivors of the Rana Plaza disasterT-shirts made by survivors of the Rana Plaza disaster. The factory Oporajeo was setup
after the Rana Plaza disaster in 2013 to create job opportunities for the
survivors from the disasters.   They make perfect gifts with an incredible story.   (We will contact you to get colour and size information after your buy the perk)We also have vouchers from the wonderful eco fashion brands below                                                            Links to designer websites:   Pachacuti Made Jewellery   Little Green Radicals  L'Herb Rouge   Komodo   A Beautiful Story  69b   KibootsFrom Somewhere   Authur and Henry   Pants to Poverty  People Tree  BibicoPicture of Pants to Poverty you can buy with our voucher - fabulous!

story:
$2000 Raised on Other Platforms! *




The Project:

One of my favorite gifts at my bridal shower was a framed art project I made in pre-school. The writing prompt was “What do you want to be when you grow up, Cassie?’ I answered simply, “I want to be a bride. I am going to dance with my husband.” It’s funny looking back, realizing my passion for weddings began as early as age 3.

My name is Cassie Wanda and I left the best job I ever had last year to pursue a career in design. I absolutely love creating costumes and playing the role of “fairy godmother” to my clients, however, I am here to ask your help in pursuing my own dream further, the dream of creating my very own wedding dress line. I’ve been developing the theme and sketches for about 4 months now, working very hard to present something to you that I am not only proud of, but truly believe will help brides-to-be find their dream fantasy wedding gown.

Finding my own dress was not the best experience, I knew what I wanted and had an extremely hard time finding an off-the-rack dress that felt like “me.” I went to a snooty boutique that I didn’t feel like cared whether or not I booked. After weeks of searching I was lucky to find a seamstress that was willing to tweak one of her own designs to add a few elements that I specifically wanted. I was elated! The dress was what I wanted and she was great to deal with. I want to make every bride who comes to me feel special, loved, and listened to in creating her dream dress.

I want to thank you so much for reading this and supporting me in any way. I truly feel that there is magic in this world knowing I am able to make a living doing what I love for a job! Now, with your help, I will be able to do it on a much more magnificent scale. Thank you. 



Dresses:

The Glimmerwood Element Wedding Line is inspired by the Classical elements. Air, Water, Fire, Earth, and the most important element, Love, influenced these flowing fantasy gowns.

Are you going to be swept into your ceremony riding the winds or waves? Will you rise up from the Earth in all your beauty or burn with passionate fire? Do you want to make a memory as queen for the day?

Read on to find out which dress is for you!




The Air Bride:

  Want to feel like a Grecian Goddess on your wedding day? You will find your match as the Air Bride. Silk chiffon drapes along, moving with you and the wind. A regal drape comes from the shoulder and tucks into the waist; It will have you dancing and twirling all day! The fabric is a gorgeous silk chiffon that transitions slowly from white to sky blue.



The Water Bride:

  Mermaids, the sea, and water nymphs inspired this dress. Delicate beaded lace with green and opal gives the effect of abalone and pearls on the front of the bodice. Ripples of lace and silk chiffon move in a way that will have your guests wondering if you are moving under water!



The Fire Bride:

  The Fire Bride dress is for the edgy girl. This dress is the most versatile of the collection. The bra top and under bust are both are adorned with gorgeous black lace. The skirt has a soft black netting with a gorgeous white beaded pattern that will shift in like smoky plumes as you walk down the aisle.



The Earth Bride:

  The Earth bride has a stunning, off the shoulder corset with delicate lace details. The silk charmeuse in the over skirt cascades over a beaded floral lace, which lies over a lavender silk. A large, hand-made silk rose is pinned with care atop the full skirt.



The Love Bride:

  The bride who is the true Queen for the Day will love the Love Bride’s dress. Inspired heavily by Rococo fashions, this will be a dress that no one will soon forget. Ivory with pale pink accents, this dress has layers of lace, silk, and ribbons. Handmade rosettes decorate the over skirt, and matching drapes and bows bring everything together in the underskirt.

All of these dresses will be available with their shown accent color, in all white, and in some cases custom colors to match your fantasy wedding!

Team:

Representing the Element of Air: Myself

  The Air Bride was the dress that fueled the collection. Throughout the many versions of this collection, this dress was always my clearest vision.  A version of the wedding dress that I tried so hard to find, eventually had to hire someone to make something custom, but with new elements to make it more magical!

Representing the Element of Water: Doe Deere of Lime Crime

  Doe has been an incredible mentor to me throughout the years I have known her. She is an inspiring woman with an inspiring story. I felt I really wanted her involved and working together during the creation of the Aquataenia Fantasy Palette, and with her passion for watery colored hair, she seemed a perfect fit.

Representing the Element of Fire: Traci Hines of Adorkable Apparel

  I met Traci a few years ago at an event and we became fast friends. I’m always excited for her new projects including her new clothing line, Adorkable Apparel. Although she is best known for being a mermaid, I was excited to bring out and show the edginess and fire in her personality.

Representing the Element of Earth: Vanessa of Creature of Habit

  Vanessa is a fellow costumer with a knack for high fashion and gorgeous floral crowns. I love having her in my life to bounce ideas off of and swap advice and support. She is also one of the most beautiful people I know, inside and out. She is constantly reminding people how important we are and how wonderful life can be.

Representing the Element of Love: Charis Lincoln of CharismaStarTV

  If you have ever seen one of Charis’ videos you should have no problem seeing why I chose her for the Love Bride. She exudes love with everything she does, and if you haven’t yet, I suggest watching the video in which her now husband, Jacob proposes to her. They have such an inspiring relationship and I am so thankful to have them both involved!

We have also put together a kick ass team of makeup artists, hair stylists, florists, and photographers that will make the commercial photo shoot of the Glimmerwood Bridal Line unforgettable and exciting for every bride to be that sees it.

Concept artwork done by Guillermo Garcia based on Glimmerwood designs. Video created with Charis and Jacob Lincoln.

Budget:

To do this project exactly how I dream it, I will need $12,400. This will pay for the following:

  • Cost of supplies and labor for the five wedding dresses
  • Photographer and artist fees
  • Flowers for the photo shoot
  • Garters for each bride
  • Initial promotional material for the line including brochures and postcards
  • Rewards and postage for them
  • Other photo shoot fees including hair, makeup, nails, and food
  • Indiegogo, PayPal, and credit card fees

What happens if I am under budget?

Luckily, with flex campaigning, funds will still be collected if we are under budget.  If this is the case, I still plan on going through with the line and photo shoot, but I may need to cut a dress from the line. As I am unwilling to cut quality of materials or my vision for the final photo shoot, this seems to be the only way to cut funds.


Projected Schedule:

Subject to slight changes, I will inform contributors to any delays as soon as I know of them. I do not expect any delays at this time.

  • March 26th – Fundraising will cease
  • March 31st – I will be drafting patterns and doing fittings with my models and begin construction as soon as I receive funds, no later than April 10th.
  • May 2nd – Construction of gowns will be finished
  • Week of May 5th – Glimmerwood Bridal Photo shoot
  • May 14th – Collection will be available for viewing and ordering on www.glimmerwoodbridal.com
  • June 1-15th – Exclusive Contributor Sale on www.glimmerwood.etsy.com
  • June 16th – All physical perks will be mailed out

* Glimmerwood eBay Costume Cleanout ended 3/3/14 and raised $1000 towards this project!
3/14/14 - Private $1000 donation to help the campaign!
