story:
______________________________________________________________________________________

 

The first mosquito resistant apparel that is comfortable, cool, pesticide free, safe, and fashionable.

 

 

 

 

Bite Resistant

The safest form of insect protection. Superfine Apparel has been tested and developed by researchers at NC State University, home of the number one College of Textiles in the world. Unlike other mosquito resistant fabrics, Superfine is completely pesticide and insecticide free, and is up to 97% effective by blocking the mosquitoes proboscis from the skin. Our team has spent hours testing our fabrics in cages of hundreds of mosquitoes.  

Our final product results in a knit that is too tight for a mosquito to penetrate, unlike other fabrics. A video of our fabric at work:

Soft and Comfortable

Sheer mosquito resistance of the softest kind. Superfine Apparel is made from the finest knitted fabric on the planet that offers comfortable stretch with every move you make. Our garments are highly breathable as shown in tests by NC State University College of Textiles, offering comfort even on the warmest days.

Harm Free

Unlike almost all other mosquito-resistant clothing, Pro-Tex clothing doesn't have any harmful chemicals or insecticides, keeping you worry free. With fabric made in Italy and clothing manufactured in the USA, we ensure that our products are created sustainably and ethically.

Econyl®Recycled fibers for a greener product:

 

 

Women's Clothing

Women's Running top

Women's Running Legging

 

Women's Yoga Top

Women's Yoga Pant

 

Men's Clothing

Men's Yoga Top

Men's Yoga Bottom

 

Men's Running Top

Men's Running Bottom

 

 

Superfine Apparel originally started as an idea created for the U.S. Army. Now, we want to help protect everyone from painful mosquito bites and mosquito borne illness.

 

 

Maternity and Children's Wear

More Designs

 

We are a team of researchers from the NC State College of Textiles, NC State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, and the NC State College of Natural Resources working together to develop the most innovative mosquito repellent clothing in the world. Our goal was to create clothing that was as safe and effective as possible by removing the need for pesticides and chemicals. We have spent the last 5 years developing and testing in cages of mosquitoes to ensure that Superfine clothing is as safe as possible. We are looking for support and partnership for this product so that we can continue innovating for the protection of mankind from vector borne illness.

story:
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO CONTRIBUTED, SPREAD THE WORD AND GAVE THEIR SUPPORT TO OUR CAMPAIGN! WE ARE SO...SO GRATEFUL! 

INLAND is THIS Weekend! We hope to see you @ 99 SUDBURY on Saturday 11-6 or Sunday 11-5 for our first retail event.  More details here www.madeinland.ca!


Help us create an event to support made-in-Canada fashion design!
Did you know that the number of people employed in the Canadian apparel manufacturing industry has declined by 7O% in the last decade!? (Stats. Canada) We were shocked too! The good news is, there is a HUGE, growing community of independent clothing and accessory designers who either hand-make or manufacture their collections right here in Canada. It's likely you didn't know this either. Our goal is to provide a retail event for these incredible, high-quality designers so they can increase sales, build their business and contribute to reviving the local apparel industry. We've called this shopping event INLAND. 

INLAND is a 2-day, curated shopping marketplace featuring 80 independent designers of clothing and accessories for men + women, all made-in-Canada. Designers will set up their mini "boutiques" at 99 Sudbury Street, a 10,000 sq.ft. brick & beam space divided into 2 elegant rooms (The Gallery + The Glass Factory), to form a stylish, multi-brand "pop-up" like no other in Canada. By providing affordable, short-term retail space, INLAND gives emerging and established designers the opportunity to extend their reach beyond wholesale and online. They will meet and sell directly to customers (with NO commissions taken), connect with other designers and entrepreneurs while pooling their networks and clientele. 

See the full INLAND 2014 Designer Line-Up HERE and click on the "Gallery" tab above for images.

You love great design and want to support Canada's arts and design community. You appreciate fine quality and ethical production practices. You support the local economy through small business and you take pride in the uniqueness of your personal style, right?  So do we! To honour this, we've carefully selected designers based on originality, aesthetic, quality and design sensibility. At INLAND, you will meet the designers of the clothes you buy! By contributing to his campaign, you will help build an exciting new platform to buy Canadian made, independent fashion!

Here's what you can do to help...


                                               #madeincanada #madeinland


    Funds raised by this campaign     will go directly towards advertising to get  shoppers in the door! Advertising is only a portion of the cost to run an event like INLAND. As a modest start-up, we've already invested in renting the venue ($18,000+), branding, business fees, website development, administration - and hundreds of hours researching and sourcing designers, watching the market, developing partnerships and reading anything and everything about Canadian and international design. We've done our homework, we've curated a stellar line-up of designers, now we just need you to help us spread the word!

    ADVERTISING TARGET BUDGET:
    Toronto Life     - Digital Big Box ad. in "TO DO" + "Style" e.newsletters $2500
    LOULOU     Full page colour ad. (we've been offered an excellent deal!)  $3000
    NOW Magazine     4 x 1/8 page colour ad. $2200
    Post City     Magazine 1/5 page colour print ad. in 4 editions + digital ad. $2600
    Designlines      1/2 page colour ad. $1800
    BlogTO     - Event Section (1 week take-over), Fashion Section(content banner) and Mobile  (25,000 impressions) $1300
    Indie 88.1 FM      on air + web combo  $900
    Banners (2), 3' x 3' event map poster, sandwich boards $200
    5000 printed colour post cards + 500  colour 8.5x11 posters $600
    Street Level Promotions and Contests $200
    Opening Night Reception media party promotions $400
    Ad. Design Fees $500

    IF we meet our goal    , we'll be able to pay for a solid advertising program to bring in enough shoppers to generate business for designers! Also, we'll start to gain the attention and credibility needed to host INLAND as an annual event! By supporting Canadian design, you will help build communities, industries and a healthy local economy. We're all in this together!

    IF we surpass our goal, we have some exciting plans to expand INLAND, provide a selling place for more designers and bring a wider spectrum of Canadian-made products to shoppers! Help us grow the Canadian-made marketplace!



    RISKS + CHALLENGES
    INLAND measures it's success in 3 key ways:
    1) Ability to recruit 80 high-quality designers to exhibit at INLAND
    2) Ability to attract 3000+ shoppers to attend and buy at INLAND
    3) Ability to provide an excellent event experience for shoppers and designers

    We have worked very hard and feel extremely confident in #1 and #3, but we need your help to ensure that we properly advertise INLAND to make #2 a reality! Please contribute today, invest in Canadian design and receive and excellent perk!

    FEATURED PERKS!

    HOT POP Factory 3-D Printed Bowties

    BREED Knitting - Merino Wool Bowties

    AMANDA MOSS - 100% Silk / Linen Shift Dress


     

    PERK #4 Limited Edition INLAND Poster     by No Paperwork

    PERK #6 Laser Cut Desk Art by local entrepreneurs HOT POP FACTORY 


    PERK #7 Heartland Skirt by Toronto designer Simone's Rose
    Color options:
    *Denim (95% cotton, 5% spandex - local fabric)
    *Gray Denim (45% organic cotton, 55% hemp) > pictured below
    *Beige pinstripe (Cotton/spandex - Lida Baday overstock fabric) > ONLY 2 avail.


      PERK #8 "New Love" Fringe Kimono by Montreal designer Norwegian Wood 


          PERK #9 Perk Pack by Toronto designer Sara Duke


          PERK #10 Limited Edition Pendent by Montreal designer Elaine Ho


          PERK #13 Custom Gown by Toronto designer Simone's Rose


          OTHER WAYS TO GIVE!

          Some of you can't give financially, but you can still help!!
          > Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram!
          > Share the campaign link with a personal email to your network! 
          > Share your thoughts, impressions and ideas with us. We want to create the best show imaginable. What compelled you to contribute? How can we improve? 
          Drop us a line! info@madeinland.ca 

          ____________________________________________________________________________

          We believe in shared experiences. Thank you to our partners & friends!
          These great companies are already helping make INLAND a reality. We are always looking to extend our community by collaborating in creative ways. Partner with us! 

          THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

(we've been offered an excellent deal!)  $3000 NOW Magazine 4 x 1/8 page colour ad. $2200Post City Magazine 1/5 page colour print ad. in 4 editions + digital ad. $2600Designlines  1/2 page colour ad. $1800BlogTO - Event Section (1 week take-over), Fashion Section(content banner) and Mobile  (25,000 impressions) $1300Indie 88.1 FM  on air + web combo  $900Banners (2), 3' x 3' event map poster, sandwich boards $2005000 printed colour post cards + 500  colour 8.5x11 posters $600Street Level Promotions and Contests $200 Opening Night Reception media party promotions $400Ad. Design Fees $500IF we meet our goal, we'll be able to pay for a solid advertising program to bring in enough shoppers to generate business for designers! Also, we'll start to gain the attention and credibility needed to host INLAND as an annual event! By supporting Canadian design, you will help build communities, industries and a healthy local economy. We're all in this together! 
IF we surpass our goal, we have some exciting plans to expand INLAND, provide a selling place for more designers and bring a wider spectrum of Canadian-made products to shoppers! Help us grow the Canadian-made marketplace! 




RISKS + CHALLENGESINLAND measures it's success in 3 key ways:1) Ability to recruit 80 high-quality designers to exhibit at INLAND 2) Ability to attract 3000+ shoppers to attend and buy at INLAND3) Ability to provide an excellent event experience for shoppers and designers
We have worked very hard and feel extremely confident in #1 and #3, but we need your help to ensure that we properly advertise INLAND to make #2 a reality! Please contribute today, invest in Canadian design and receive and excellent perk!



FEATURED PERKS!

HOT POP Factory 3-D Printed Bowties


BREED Knitting - Merino Wool Bowties


AMANDA MOSS - 100% Silk / Linen Shift Dress 

 PERK #4 Limited Edition INLAND Poster by No Paperwork

PERK #6 Laser Cut Desk Art by local entrepreneurs HOT POP FACTORY  
PERK #7 Heartland Skirt by Toronto designer Simone's RoseColor options:*Denim (95% cotton, 5% spandex - local fabric)*Gray Denim (45% organic cotton, 55% hemp) > pictured below*Beige pinstripe (Cotton/spandex - Lida Baday overstock fabric) > ONLY 2 avail.




PERK #8 "New Love" Fringe Kimono by Montreal designer Norwegian Wood 







PERK #9 Perk Pack by Toronto designer Sara Duke

PERK #10 Limited Edition Pendent
    by Montreal designer Elaine Ho

PERK #13 Custom Gown by Toronto designer Simone's Rose



OTHER WAYS TO GIVE! 
Some of you can't give financially, but you can still help!!> Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram! > Share the campaign link with a personal email to your network! > Share your thoughts, impressions and ideas with us. We want to create the best show imaginable. What compelled you to contribute? How can we improve? Drop us a line! info@madeinland.ca 
____________________________________________________________________________
We believe in shared experiences. Thank you to our partners & friends! These great companies are already helping make INLAND a reality. We are always looking to extend our community by collaborating in creative ways. Partner with us! 

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

story:
Die deutsche Version finden Sie nach der englischen.

 

The problem

Just imagine you are walking with a stroller down a steep road and suddenly you stumble. Such scenarios are possible and therefore you might have read headlines such as:

  • Stroller rolling into a rover (Davos 24.06.2012)
  • Storm hits stroller (Hannover 04.01.2012)
  • Stroller rolls in front of a train (15.10.2009)

 I am a proud father for three years now. While walking with my son sitting in his stroller I asked myself sometimes: “What happens if I the stroller wanders off?”

I did some research and looked for a system that brings my stroller to a halt automatically. There are only a handful of mechanical solutions. Most systems work by pulling a lever while waling with the stroller. None of those seemed to be really comfortable.

So I decided to build my own break. Unfortunately this task was way harder than I imagined.

This was more than a year ago

Since then a lot of things happened. In cooperation with a commercial academy and a technical school I started a project in the form of a dissertation. I was supervising the technical part and we build the first prototype.

The solution

Our system works contact-less. Sensors detect if the strollers is handled by a person or not. As long as the stroller is idle the breaks are closed. When the user puts his hands on the handle the systems unblocks the tires. Furthermore for safety reasons the whole system can also be controlled manually. For example when the battery is empty.

The product will be available in two versions:

  • Cabella
    This type is only for strollers that have an integrated hand brake. The retail price will be € 120.-

  • Cabella pro
    This version can be installed on any stroller. The retail price will be € 150.-

After for years we are planning to build brakes for similar products such as wheel chairs.

 

The project status

The functional principle works! Right now we are working on a better mechanical construction and we are improving the electronic components. The version right know will be ready for a pilot batch soon.

The business plan is almost finished and we are looking for partners and financing options.


What wee need

  • We are techies
    We can solve technical problems. However we also need are partners for sales and marketing. Professionals are necessary.

     

  • As always, we need money
    Until now everything was self-financed but this is not possible any more. The effort would be too big.

On what will the money be used for

This money will be used to build the second prototype. This one should include all functions of the final product. Therefore the design has to be reworked. Since this is a prototype every component will be hand made:

  • adapting the electronics to SMD-technology € 1.000,-

  • reworking the design € 2.000,-
  • manufacturing the casing € 200,-
  • manufacturing the casing € 100,-
  • assemble the electrical components including the board € 1.500,-
  • miscellaneous € 200,-

What we offer

We are very thankful for any support and would like the give you some of our perks.

If you want to partner with us you can either be:

  • a full partner (€ 20.000 and above)
  • a dormant partner (€ 10.000 and above)

How can you help aus

  • If you have any ideas for you product, let us know!
  • If you have contacts in this branch, let us know!
  • Like and share us on Facebook or Google+

Future plans

Our goal is to start a business in the beginning of 2013. We want to refine our product all the way to mass production. In summer 2013 we want to start selling our product.

The production will we situated in Austria.

 

 

Die Ausgangssituation

Oder stellen Sie sich vor, Sie schieben Ihren Kinderwagen auf einer steilen Straße und stürzen. Solche Gedanken sind nicht unrealistisch. Des öfteren liest man Schlagzeilen wie:

  • Kinderwagen stürzt in Bach (Davos 24.06.2012)

  • Sturmböe erfasst Kinderwagen (Hannover 04.01.2012)

  • Kinderwagen rollt vor Zug (15.10.2009)

Ich bin seit drei Jahren stolzer Vater. Beim Spazieren mit dem Kinderwagen stellte sich mir des öfteren die Frage: "Was passiert, wenn mir der Kinderwagen auskommt?"

Ich recherchierte nach Sicherheitssystemen, die einen Kinderwagen von selbst zum Stillstand bringen. Es gab dazu nur einige wenig praktikable mechanische Lösungen, bei denen man die ganzen Zeit einen Hebel festhalten muß. Leider war in meinen Augen keine einzige der gefundenen Anwendungen bedienerfreundlich.

Also sagte ich mir: "Dann baue ich mir eben selbst eines". Leider war es nicht ganz so einfach, wie ich dachte.

Das war vor mehr als einem Jahr.

Seitdem geschah einiges. Das entwickelte Funktionsprinzip wurde umgesetzt. An einer Handelsakademie (an der ich ebenfalls unterrichte) wurde in einer Diplomarbeit eine Markterhebung gemacht. Ich selbst betreute an meiner Schule eine Diplomarbeit bei der ein Prototyp hergestellt wurde.

Das Problem

Das Problem ist, dass Personen die einen Kinderwagen schieben, des öfteren abgelenkt werden. In dieser Zeit kann sich der Kinderwagen unbeabsichtigt in Bewegung setzen. Um dies zu verhindern, gibt es Sperrbremsen, die jedoch gezielt (meist per Fußwippe) eingelegt werden müssen. Wird man abgelenkt, so vergisst man, diese einzulegen.

Weiters kann es passieren, dass man stolpert. Auch hier ist meist keine Zeit mehr, um die Bremse einzulegen.

Die Lösung

Unser Konzept (die Kinderwagensicherheitsbremse) reagiert berührungslos. Die Steuerung reagiert auf Sensoren, welche erkennen, ob das Fahrzeug von einer Bedienperson geschoben, gebremst oder in gleichmäßiger Bewegung gehalten wird. Im Ruhezustand hält das System die Bremsen im gesperrten Zustand. Sobald der Bediener das Fahrzeug an den Haltegriffen berührt, werden die Bremsen gelöst. Zusätzlich ist noch eine manuelle Bedienung des Bremssystems möglich.

Das Produkt soll in zwei Varianten vertrieben werden:

  • Cabella
    Das Produkt zur Integration in eine vorhandene Seilzugbremse. Der Endkundenpreis ist mit € 120,- Brutto geplant.

 

  • Cabella pro
    Das Folgeprodukt für Kinderwägen die keine Seilzugbremse eingebaut haben. Es wird hier ein Endkundenpreis € 150,- Brutto geplant.




 

Eine Diversifikation auf verwandte Bereiche (z.B. Rollstühle) ist ab dem fünften Jahr geplant.

 

 

Der Projektstand

Das Funktionsprinzip ist umgesetzt und getestet. Aktuell wird an einer neuen mechanischen Konstruktion und an der Überarbeitung der Steuerplatine gearbeitet. Das Modul wird in Richtung Vorserienreife weiterentwickelt.

Der Businessplan ist im Endstadium und es wurde mit der Suche nach Partnern und Förderungs- u. Finanzierungsmöglichkeiten begonnen.

Was brauchen wir

  • Wir sind Technik- Freaks.
    Die technischen Probleme lösen wir. Was wir noch brauchen sind Partner für den Vertrieb und das Marketing. Profis sind notwendig.

  • Wie immer benötigen wir Geld.
    Bis jetzt wurde alles privat finanziert. Das geht nicht mehr, die Aufwände werden einfach zu umfangreich.

Wozu verwenden wir das Geld

Die hier erhaltenen Gelder benötigen wir, um den zweiten Prototypen bauen zu können. Dieser soll bereits alle Funktionen des Endproduktes bieten. Dazu muss die Konstruktion überarbeitet werden. Da es sich um ein Einzelstück handelt, müssen alle Teile von Hand gefertigt werden:

  • Anpassen der Platine auf SMC- Technik ca. € 1.000,-
  • Überarbeiten der mechanischen Konstruktion ca. € 2.000,-
  • 3D- Druck des Gehäuses ca. € 200,-
  • Elektronische Bauteile im Einzelhandel ca. 100,-
  • Herstellen der Einzelteile und der Platine ca. € 1.500,-
  • Sonstiges € 200,-

Was bieten wir

  • Allen die uns unterstützen danken wir im Rahmen unserer Möglichkeiten und der Perks.
  • Partnern bieten wir ein Beteiligungskonzept an:
    •  Stille Gesellschafter ab € 10.000.-
    •  Gesellschafter ab € 20.000,-

Wie kannst du uns noch mithelfen

  • Wenn du Ideen zu unseren Produkten hast, lass Sie uns wissen
  • Hast du Kontakte in die Branchen, teile sie uns mit
  • Teile unsere Seite auf Google+
  • Teile unsere Seite auf Facebook

 

 Hilf uns, aufzufallen!!

 

Wie gehts weiter

Das Ziel ist bis Anfang 2013 ein Unternehmen zu gründen. Im Frühjahr soll ein serienreifes Produkt entwickelt und Zulieferer für die Komponenten gefunden werden. Bis zum Sommer 2013 wollen wir mit dem ersten Produkten auf den Markt kommen.

Das Produkt soll in Österreich hergestellt werden.

story:
Thoughtfully designed in Japan, Scooter One’s patented technology is specifically engineered to blend a mix of renewable fabrics and materials that enhance the durability and functionality of each part of the shoe.

 

This advanced technology creates a lightweight, ultra-soft, and fully cushioned sneaker that is completely toxin-free and nature friendly.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Thorough review from Imperfect Idealist

 

   

Scooter One Shoes look, feel, and even smell like traditional leather thanks to our Prime Fiber Leather. It’s an integration of upcycled leather and vegan leather making it a sustainable alternative to traditional leather.

 

Prime Fiber Leather utilizes existing materials rather than killing new animals, requires very minimal processing which keeps material out of landfills. Plus, it’s lighter and stronger than traditional leather, waterproof and scratch-resistant!

This incredible material is certified by GRS (Global Recycled Standard), an international, voluntary, full product standard that sets requirements for third-party certification of recycled content, chain of custody, social and environmental practices, and chemical restrictions. The GRS's objective is to define requirements to ensure accurate content claims and right working conditions, so the harmful impact on environments is minimized.

 

Stay cool, comfortable and feeling fresh with our patented Soufflé Fit Technology™.

 

There was no fabric for the lining material that we could find on the current market that was up to our standard of comfort level, so we developed our own special Soufflé Fit Technology™ to produce a fabric that is extremely soft, breathable, and moisture-wicking.

 

The lining and sock material are made of a unique blend of Merino Wool and an all-natural, renewable fiber mixed with Tencel fabric from sustainably harvested forestry. This fabric is also antimicrobial and odor-eliminating so socks are always optional.

 

Are you ready for all-day comfort? The midsole and rubber outsole of the shoes are made with Popcorn Technology ™, our unique dual-density technology that’s ultra-flexible and molds to your every move.

 

We named this Popcorn Technology™ because it features excellent shock absorption and adds durability and traction to the shoe. Unlike the average rubber outsole of a classic sneaker, Scooter One's high-elastic EVA pad targets two main pressure points on the soles. This conforms and adds cushion to your entire foot for lasting comfort throughout the day.

 

It is a revolutionary cushioning technology that is super lightweight, which provides the highest energy return when you are running or walking. Say “goodbye” to tired feet!

 

 

Scooter One Shoes are good for you and good for the planet.  

 

We use 100% eco-friendly pigments to create that bright, shiny exterior. We don’t use any harmful dyes or chemicals. The leather coating of Prime Fiber Leather is free of DMF’s (dimethyl formaldehyde), a substance that can occur in liver damage if absorbed by the skin.  

 

Our laces are made of 100% cotton, and the soles are a mix of 90% natural rubber and 10% recycled rubber. We guarantee that the entirety of Scooter One Shoes is made with harmless and sustainable materials.

 

Our shoe box is made with 100% recyclable cardboard that is sustainable. It has a double layer protection that is sturdy enough to hold Scooter Ones in place so that no additional packaging is needed.

Disclaimer: Due to the pandemic and the holiday supply chain surges,

the current estimated shipping date is 1/15/2021

Still unsure about your size? Take two to three pairs of your current sneakers and measure the shoe length in Centimeters. Match the correct length in the Japan shoes size to find out the right US size for your Scooter One Shoes.

 

Scooter One Shoes is our first contribution to the slow fashion movement, a movement towards mindful manufacturing, fair labor rights, natural materials, and lasting garments. Our goal is to go beyond slow fashion to create ever-lasting product designs with a minimalist, classic style and durable materials to be worn year after year.

 

We are Projext & Co, a group of footwear industry experts, international designers, engineers, and creators who aspire to develop products that derive from thinking outside of the box. With over 20 years of experience in the footwear space, our team is familiar with every aspect of the industry workflow including prototyping, materials sourcing, commercializing, production and quality assurance.

 

At Projext & Co, we want to go beyond slow fashion and push the boundaries of mindful manufacturing, natural materials, and the latest technology to create ever-lasting products that transcend through time. “Projext” is the combination of “Project” and “Next”, manifesting the vision that we are constantly seeking, evolving, and challenging new ideas to develop products that invigorate our live.

                          

Scooter One is our first project to take on our mission to redefine the classic sneaker. Our first prototype features the latest technological enhancement that is lightweight, multi-functional, and super flexible. We are committed to creating a timeless, eco-conscious, and wholesome brand to spark curiosity in your everyday life.

 

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project. If you’re a supporter of our mission, help us spread the word on Social and anywhere else you can think of!
